Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice and quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rutan77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel last weekend, and really enjoyed our stay, in the heart of the Latin Quarters. Clean and quiet room, friendly staff. The Buffet breakfast for an extra 12 euros is quite modest, but truly french and tasty. A good place to start exploring Paris, walking distance to great places and sights (Seine, Notre Dame, Louvre, Les Marais) and busy cafes and restaurants, yet situated in a tranquil corner of the Latin Quarters. Nice bistro with tasty and generous lunch meals on the corner. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: bjdean916
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this location late at night and the man on staff was great (so wish I could remember his name). He gave us great advice on places to eat and set us up with the tour around town. The room was clean and well kept. We would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location..”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on March 12 2012. This was our first hotel on our European vacation..we slept all night on plane from US went to Madrid for the day then took a Spanish Airline to Paris. I will say if you get a taxi from the Charles G Airport...it is the most expensive option available We were looking forward to our shower and room...the lobby is beautiful and the location is great bc you can easily walk to the Notre Dame Cathedral. Also look for Shakespeare and Co... it is near the ND Cathedral. It's a famous bookstore...Samantha Brown from the travel channel recommends it and do I. This hotel is also very near the tube (Metro) subway...so you can easily access all of Paris within minutes. I rated this hotel average because of the bathroom, stairs, and hallways. This hotel is excellent in price and they will hold your luggage after you check out while you tour the city.However..The rooms are very small, while they are updated..the walls seems to be paper thin. The elevator is more of a luggage lift..or a one person/one suitcase lift. If you are wanting to experience Paris as they did 20 years ago plus then this is a great hotel bc it is VERY SMALL as it is in the older, most historic part of Paris. The staff is very nice and as far as rooms go it was okay. My wife did not like the fact that there were no curtains on bathroom window. Don't expect to watch tv there is maybe 5 channels 2 clear and none in English, as you really shouldn't want to...YOU are in Paris. No Ac either but there heating. It is just fine if you crack a couple windows. There is a toilet seat on toliet...you will find if you look for toliet in the city site seeing...toliet seats are MIA..which is very important to women at all times and men only sometimes. We recommend the Cafe/Patissere (that is as you are leaving hotel directly next door on right.) fabulous coffee, capp, and french goodies. There is a Parisian Street Market during most days across street from Metro entrance. Many places to exchange currency in walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to someone on a budget.. They do have free Wifi.. just ask the front desk and follow his or her instructions..it is not complicated but there is a short process. The only had one american plug converter and it was being used so your best bet is to buy your own and keep it with you for charging phones/comp, or straightening hair, etc

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrisKeune
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in Paris. I stayed for 7 nights at Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain. I loved this hotel. Its location is perfect, near Notre Dame, a very central spot for Paris. There is a metro station nearby, just one block of walking distance. I took the room 57, a double comfort room, with view to Boulevard Saint Germain. The room is a little small, but for me that's not a problem, and it is very acceptable for a hotel in Paris. Both room and bathroom were very clean, and the décor is nice. The bed was extremely comfortable. For Paris standarts, it was a lovely room. In the room, there is a LCD flat screen TV with internacional channels, Free Wi-Fi, small refrigerador, hair dryer, eletronic safe, air conditioning and a very good shower in the bathroom. The towels were daily changed. I did the on-line booking directely at the Hotel website and everything went well. The 7 nights on-line promotional booking was with breakfeast included. The breakfeast buffet was very good and complete (the only thing lacking was ham or "jamón"). The staff was very polite and helpful, giving me all the information I needed, and even helping me to book a shuttle to Orly Airport in the last night. In fine, I really enjoyed my stay in Paris at Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain. I certainly would recomend it for everyone. And when I come back to Paris I most sure will stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Nicest Placest to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Travelfreak63
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain is located in the center of everything. You can walk to all of the major touristic sites in Paris. It has lovely staff and great room size (for Europe). The view from the upper level floors is breath taking. The back 'yard' is Notre Dame De Paris. For what more could one ask?

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to a great hotel; the only place we'll stay!”
Reviews.Author: DerekAmanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during Thanksgiving (US Holiday) 2011. November 24 – 26, 2011. Three nights. This was our second visit to this hotel (first visit was November 2009). Everything we wrote about this hotel in 2009 holds up, but some recent additions made the hotel all the better … Refurbished rooms: The hotel was kind enough to give us the exact same room we had two years ago. We noticed that it had been refurbished with new carpet and artwork. This made the room feel even nicer than the great experience we had the first time we stayed here. Wifi: The hotel added wifi. Signing in on the network was very easy. You must do a simple registration on your device and then ask the front desk (who can see your registration) to allow you access. Airport Shuttle: Ask the front desk about their shuttle to the airport. It was great. It only cost about $20 for both of us. It picked us up on time and only made a few stops at hotels very near ours. It was quite possibly the fastest ride I have ever taken (I think we hit Mach 1 at one point). But it was very nice, professional, and clean. It is a “cash” deal from what we could tell. As before, the hotel staff is extremely professional and will call any tourist attraction, restaurant, or event for you to inquire about seating, reservations, or event changes. All front desk staff members speak fluent French and English. Unlike 2009, we took a picture of the fire escape floor plan on the back of the hotel door. This way you can see how rooms are not the same in size. You really can score a great deal by asking for a specific room. Try staying on the 5th or 6th floor to allow you balcony access (there are no balconies on the 4th floor and lower). Safe travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel4444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went in November of 2011. The weather was great. It was in the mid 50’s the entire week that we were there and it only rained once. We loved everything about Paris. The other reviews are correct. The hotel is small but you can’t beat the location. It is about two blocks from Notre Dame (a 3 min walk). There was plenty of shopping and places to eat in the area. The Metro was close and easy to use. However, we were able to walk to many of the sites like the Louve, Sainte Chapelle, La Conciergerie (prison where Marie Antoinette was held before being beheaded), Pont Neuf (Oldest bridge in Paris), we even walked to Musee d’Orsay but that was a long walk. The staff was okay, I would not say they were the friendliest and some of the people at the front desk did not speak English. Lucky for me, I did my research and did not need too much of the staffs assistance. I would defiantly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: John9511
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the best location if you want to stay near Notre Dame in the 6th ar. It was literally 2 blocks from the river and behind the Notre Dame. The hotel room we stayed in for 2 nights/3 days was very small. I had accidentally booked a single online and when we went to check-in no double rooms were available. However, we made a single work. There was a full bed with an enclosed bathroom with shower and hair dryer. So, if worst comes to worst a single will be fine if your visiting for a couple of days. A few things to be aware of: the walls like any in Europe are paper thin, if you have a late departure you have to leave your bags in another room unattended (which was uncomfortable) nothing happened to our bags but it was a worry of mine.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: inchicore
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and four friends for a weekend break. Everything that other reviewers say is correct. It is a small hotel but it's location couldn't be better. As you walk to your room you may be forgiven for saying "My God what have I booked" as the lift is tiny and the corridor is very old. But the rooms are really nice and decor pretty modern. The heating and plumbing is a bit noisy but don't let that put you off staying here as it is so well located and will save you a fortune in taxi costs. Breakfast is €12. We went around the corner to the local cafe for considerably less. Enjoy your trip to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Location, location location!”
Reviews.Author: Floridian79
Reviews.Content: I had been advised by a seasoned Paris visitor to stay central, preferably on the left bank. I found the Abbatial and was hesitant at first due to some negative reviews. The price was right (for Christmas week) and the location was awesome. I even emailed the hotel prior to my departure asking for a room on the top floor and they responded promptly that they would definitely try. When I called to inform them that we were not arriving in Paris until the following day due to a railroad strike in Belgium, they were very understanding and still honored our reservation. No fees were charged, the rate remained the same. I figured they would not be able to honor my top floor request but I was wrong. We still got a room on the sixth floor (#66, I think), facing Blvd St. Germain with a great view. The room was fairly small (for American standards) but it was clean. The bathroom was very clean as well. The coffee maker worked just fine as well as the TV and the safe. They kept our bags for the entire day when we checked out for free (our train was at 9pm). Since there wasn't a bellman, we didn't even have to tip! It's a definitely family run hotel not a chain nor 5 stars. Since I was not expecting The Four Seasons or The Ritz-Carlton, I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location (walking and metro) - all you need in Paris”
Reviews.Author: lawbarbie
Reviews.Content: Although St Germain is in the name, it is in the Latin Quarter - on all maps of the city in guidebooks it is just off the map for St Germain. Not that it mattered. You can walk everywhere, there is a metro station right outside (where on some mornings there is an amazing market with cheeses, olives, breads and more!). The staff are friendly, there 24 hours which is handy. The elevator we nicknamed the 'elevator of doom' so on the 4th floor we ended up walking 77 steps to get up to or room or down from our room - but we didn't mind. The room is small - but what you expect in Paris. Not unbearably small that you can't walk in it. The bathroom was good - the glass on the shower in place of a curtain was a bit too short so we ended up having to be careful not to get water all over the floor. The place was very tidy, looked after well. Only thing was that it was very hot, even over new years in winter, so we often opened up the big windows - which was great apart from in the morning when it smelt like smoke (from the kitchen?). The king/queen bed is 2 twins put together, which is a bit annoying, but we survived. We were out of the room from about 9am to 11pm so it didn't really matter what the room was like - it was a good place to sleep, shower, and a good base for the metro. We ended up walking from Arc de Triumph back to the hotel - it took a while, but we did it without thinking about the distance. It was a good price compared to other hotels within the same price range (based on reviews and our experience). Also the free wifi was great. Despite having to call down to reception to register - why can't they just give you a password I don't know!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, typical Parisian room size”
Reviews.Author: sterist
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over Christmas. It's perfect location made really easy to walk to metro, Notre Dame and Latin quarter. Our room is very small, which is typical in Paris, with newly renovated bathroom. Facing the street and church, it can get quite noisy if you are a light sleeper. The wall is not well sound-proofed so we can hear our neighbor's talking. The staff is 24hrs on reception and very friendly. We also find it very helpful they have free wifi in the entire hotel. Overall I think it's a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very European sized”
Reviews.Author: spooncherry
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews and fully expected the room to be small. Despite packing very light for our week's stay, making the room livable around our stuff did turn into a nightly game of Tetris. The location is fantastic if you're doing the Parisian tourist thing. Internet service was unreliable - a bit of a problem, since we selected the hotel in part because it had wireless and we weren't in a position to just "leave it all at home" for our vacation. It was fixed, but it was broken two nights in a row. While normally the staff is quite friendly and tolerant of the Americans, I was treated to some famous French rudeness when I was told I'd here in 90 minutes if there WAS a fix (or if I needed a cyber cafe) and I called to inquire three hours later. If you have a sense of humor even while jet lagged, get a look at the elevator. You'll see what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “There's a lot to like about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dudeinlosgatos
Reviews.Content: There’s a lot to like about this hotel and overall I would recommend it. There were only two frustrating elements upon which they could improve. Here’s the lowdown: The best aspect of this hotel is the location. First time travelers to Paris will definitely want to stay in the Latin or St. Germain quarters as they will have the look and feel of the Paris you seek. Quaint narrow streets that meander in every direction make it a wonderful place to explore. The neighborhood is clean and safe; I came home after midnight during the week from bars and felt comfortable walking the streets even though very few people were on them. It’s quiet late at night. Notre Dame is a five minute walk as well as the Ile St. Louis which is a great place to explore if you want to get off the beaten path away from packs of tourists. Front desk staff was friendly and Veronique’s English far exceeded my French. The front desk is staffed 24 hours a day. My room on the 5th floor (American 6th) looked like the one on the website with a black, brown and cream motif with everything seemingly recently renovated. Two French doors with a small step-out balcony provided a great view and fresh air. Bathroom was nicely appointed with a great dual head shower (rain and wand) and awesome bath products. Overall everything was very clean. Bed very comfortable with nice pillows and great sheets. Mini bar with decent prices (3E for a Heineken) and a TV. I had booked a single but believe I was upgraded to a double as this room was plenty big for two average-sized people so this was a very nice gesture on the hotel’s part and much appreciated. The only two frustrating elements of this hotel were that there was no computer for guests to use in terms of checking emails or using the Internet to verify open/close times of different sites. This was so helpful in the past at other hotels at which I stayed. So many hotels in Europe provide this service and while Europeans with smart phones don’t need this it’s harder for Americans whose phones will not work in Europe. I had trouble getting messages as there is no voice mail system for a caller to be transferred to like in American hotels. One block away was a youth hostel where I could pay to use their computer. The price at the youth hostel was E1 for 10 minutes of use. It’s an Internet kiosk which was awkward to use but got the job done. When I got to London my contact said he had trouble leaving a message and was told to call back because there was no pencil, another attempt told to call back because the person was too busy to take the message. A third call the person spoke no English (OK – understandable since it’s France). Another aspect about this trip to France (my fourth in the past six years) was the sticker shock. A large beer E9.60! Simple cafés with hamburgers and sandwiches for E18-22! Even wine has gone up considerably. This may explain why so many cafes and brasseries were empty. Who can afford to go out? The inflation of the past few years is incredible. Luckily there were two amazing pastry shops, small grocer where I got a cheap beer and the most amazing pear I’ve ever eaten; a cheese shop and meat shop. So it’s easy to eat great food for less money. In the square is a farmers market every couple of days. Another good option. On the pedestrian streets of the Latin quarter are some cheaper food options such as E10-15 for a three-course meal. While touristy it’s a good area and good food. Lots of choices and restaurateurs who are welcoming and want your business. Metro stop 1.5 block away which again made this a great hotel to have as home base. The Paris Metro is the best in the world hands down. So again, I would stay here in the future and recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A Great start to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Wayne K
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor reviews I was very worried about the size of the room and was expecting a tiny box of a room. Being our first trip to Europe we didn't know what to expect. We were very presently surprised by the Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain. The hotel was easy to find and very close to the metro station. Check-in was quick and hassel-free. Our room was perfect, just what we needed after a long flight from South Africa. Admittedly it was not the biggest room but more than adequit for our needs. The finishings in the room were high quality and luxurious. Everything was clean and in good working order. Bathroom was big enough and clean. Our room had a balcony and although we did not have a view of Notre Dame, our view along St Germain Boulevard was still pleasing. At night, with the windows closed there was no noise from the busy street outside. The hotel location is perfect and is within easy walking distance of many major sites and the rest are easily accessible by metro or boat. The only negative comment of this hotel is the teeny-tiny elevator which can only just fit 2 adults with no luggage or else 1 adult with only 1 suitcase. We enjoyed our stay at Abbatial St Germain and would recommend it to fellow travelers and would stay here again next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “THEY CANCELLED OUR BOOKING WITHOUT PRIOR NOTICE.”
Reviews.Author: antstratis
Reviews.Content: WARNING!! triple-check your booking before arriving into town! When we arrived there we were informed that there was a problem with our room and that we had to move to hotel Agora-st.germen . The hotel that we were sent was under innovation, with terrible noise in the morning,due to maintenance to all the doors of the hotel. When we complained to the reception they were rude enough to tell us that "it is not our responsibility, you can leave a note to the managment !!! ". Of course no manager was around to talk with..... The room that we was sent to was very very very small and nothing quite close to the room that we had already booked.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with nice but tiny rooms. Friendly staff and great location.”
Reviews.Author: sharsidd
Reviews.Content: Well appointed hotel with friendly and accommodating staff. The building is old but the rooms are modern and plush, with our only grouse is that they are tiny (plus ours also had a weird picture of a woman looking at us), but at that price in the heart of Paris one can't really complain. Bathroom was spotless and of a good size, with excellent fittings and a very well powered shower that just comes on at the perfect temperature (this is a must for me!) I am not an early sleeper so can't comment on how noisy or not the room is (returned to the room only well past 3 am) and didn't use the breakfast facilities so no comment on that. Also appears to have the world's tiniest lift (elevator) that can barely accomodate two people... Location is also excellent for transport as well as sightseeing, and there are good cafes and restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Mike1227
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel in the triple room recently on a 2 day visit to Paris. The hotel was easy to find, in a nice location with everything close by. Upon checking in, we put our bags in the room next to the lobby, with a bunch of other travelers bags. It was not the most organized procedure but it worked fine. The location is amazing. A 5 minute walk to the Cathedral of Notre Dame and the Pantheon. 15-20 minute walk to the Louvre. It had a few pastry shops, tons of cafes close by, and many restaurants walking towards the major sites. Also, starbucks has two locations within about 5 blocks. The hotel was very clean, and nicely decorated rooms. The triple was smaller than shown in the picture, but for Paris it was a nice size room, and had a great bathroom. A very small balcony that gave the view of the Cathedral of Notre Dame was very nice too. Not amazing, but nice. Did not try the breakfast at 12 euros a person, with all the pastry shops and cafes, I would recommend searching out in the city and getting a bit cheaper price. My parents headed to the CDG airport upon leaving, and it was very easy to access the RER B by walking from this area even with a few bags. Overall, for 3 adults to stay in a hotel in Paris, it was a good price, great area, and had no complaints about this hotel. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Room/ Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Nick B
Reviews.Content: After Reading the reviews of the hotel I couldn’t wait to stay at the place. I think all bar one review was extremely positive. Unfortunately on arrival there was a delay in checking in, due to a broken curtain rail, this was something and nothing and did not hinder the stay. We did however have many other issues with the room which did affect our stay, we had booked a refurbished deluxe room, as advertised on the internet, when we arrived at room 12 we found that the wood around the desk /minibar badly damaged and splintering off, the tiles in the bathroom were not grouted, bad paintwork around the shower frame, the hairdryer in the bathroom was broken and parcel taped together, the carpets were filthy, there were grease marks on the headboard, blood on one of the curtains and rather than a double bed we were put in two small single beds pushed together. from my point of view this is not acceptable, small oversights are part and parcel of life, but there was no effort made to even make the room slightly acceptable. I did speak with the manager who told me there was nothing he could do until the next day, not even clean the room. He told us that rooms could not constantly be fixed – in my opinion there had been plenty of time for the room to be fixed as it was not the previous guests who caused all the problems. We would have left and stayed elsewhere but it was too late to find another hotel. For the second night we were moved rooms to room 45. this room was as we expected, the room looked like it had been refurbished, the bathroom was clean and tidy and we thoroughly enjoyed the stay in this room. We were also offered a complimentary breakfast but in light of the problems we had with the room on the first day this was the least that could be done. I only hope that before anybody else stays in the room they fully refurbish the room to a high standard as advertised. It is a shame that the first room was not to the standard of the second room, but considering this was 50% of the trip I was left very disappointed about our stay. I did highlight the errors to the hotel in a letter again after leaving hoping I would get a response, and that they would take heed to renovate the room so no other customers had the same experience, although after two weeks I have not had a response hence sharing the information on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “A real find in Paris Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Lisa D
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in Paris Oct. 26-28, 2011 and I could not praise the Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain any more. You'll read others talk about the room size - and yes they are not huge rooms - but they are beautiful and charming. And I don't think you could find any better rooms in the area - especially not for the price. Book Abbatial through their website online and you'll get a good discount. Our room was a comfort room and had a gorgeous view of St. Germain and a very old church (St. Nicholas I think) through windows that opened up to a small railing/overlook My husband is a very light sleeper and once we closed the windows for the night, there was no noise in the room. The entire buidling is charming as was the hotel staff. Kareem at the front desk gave us wonderful recommendations and was a friend by the end of the trip. And the location is singular. A block from the metro (Maubert Mutualite - turn right if come out at St. Germain exit, walk just over a block and cross the street), it's also two short blocks from Notre Dame. And right in the Latin Quarter so we constantly planned to walk around it's alleys and get lost in areas 5th and 6th of Paris. Everything looked so good online we were amazed to find it just as good and wonderful in person. Definiteiy stay here. Better than an apartment stay, I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “I definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melisande M
Reviews.Content: This is a quite charming hotel, clean, very well located and with what I think is quite important - very nice employees. The room was not big, but enough for arranging my things, sleeping well and taking a good bath. Did not need more. It is very close to a subway station and to many attractions of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Staff”
Reviews.Author: Alex-gad
Reviews.Content: Oh, the location, 5 minutes by foot to the Notre Dame, 15 minutes to the Pantheon, 20 minutes, by foot to Luxembourg gardens. Close by Metro, a choice of restaurants and an excellent bakery a block away. We stayed in the Deluxe room and it was reasonably spacious compared to the typical Paris dungeons. The staff was helpful and courteous. The breakfast was an extended continental with scrambled eggs and sausages to boost the bread butter, jam and croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: yanwk
Reviews.Content: The English speaking staff were good for us Aussies. Nothing was a problem, they were most helpful. The underground carpark was a bonus as it wass only no more than 100 metres across the road from the hotel. The rooms were average size, but comfortable and clean with a good bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed impression”
Reviews.Author: aozh
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in the hotel in September 2011. My mixed feeling is based on following factors. Stuff: - Liked: very friendly and cooperative Price: - Tooooo high (~250 Euro per night), but it is difficult to judge: Paris is an expensive city Cleanliness: - Liked allover except for one (questionable) incident: once I caught a bug in my bed. Not sure if it was infamous "bed bug" - in that case the hotel is in trouble. I reported it to the stuff and do not know the consequences. Location: - Liked: excellent location; 5 minutes walk to Notre Dame and Île Saint-Louis. - Disliked: the closest metro station belongs to a left-bank-only line, so that to come here from other parts of the city you need to change lines, which takes too much time in Paris. So it does not make sense to use metro for short distances. Result: suring our stay we just walked, did not use metro at all. Internet: - Mixed feelings: there is WiFi, but the quality is not good; need to find a place in the room. However this is the way it is with most hotels. Convenience: - Liked: electric kettle and tea bags in the room. Much better that those coffee-makers I saw in American hotels, especially for people that like tea. - Disliked: no available electric outlets except in the bathroom. The hotel provides WiFi, people nowadays have laptops and several mobile devices; however to charge them I needed to switch off TV, fridge, or electric kettle. A shame.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Amazing people.”
Reviews.Author: LoisLane235
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Abbatial for our honeymoon in Paris. We are 23 and 24 years old, and needed a hotel that was decently priced but still clean and nice. Abbatial blew away our expectations! We booked six months in advance on Expedia, and I added a little note on the website that I would prefer a "higher floor with a balcony if available" ... I honestly didn't expect that request to be fulfilled, but it was! They put us on the top floor (level five) in a room with a walk out balcony for no extra cost. The room is cleaned thoroughly every day by their staff, and the beds are made up comfortably and very clean. The bedspread is a fluffy, white, down comforter -- we've been so comfortable every night! The balcony gave us a gorgeous view of the Latin Quarter. There is a nice, tall wardrobe so you can hang your clothes, and a few shelves with a safe for security, and a mini fridge. The lights are even well placed, with switches right by your bed so you don't have to get up if you forgot to turn off the lights! Totally comfortable little room, to say the least. Also, a little side note about the staff -- one night my husband brought me home a red rose before dinner. Side-tracked, I left the rose on the desk. We went out to dinner, fell asleep, went out the next morning for a day at the Louvre, and when we got back they had cleaned our room and put my rose in a vase of water to keep it from wilting! If anyone complains that the room is too small, then I would say perhaps that THEY are too big. The room is an adequate size for two people staying in Paris... especially for the money. Great room, great decor, great service. Also check out the restaurant just outside the front door of the hotel. If you're facing the hotel, it is on your immediate right. The staff at this restaurant were amazing, the food was delicious and the drinks were cheap. The servers were the friendliest we met in Paris, and really catered to us even though we didn't speak a word of French... They offered us English menus and joked with us that they could teach us French while we were visiting. I would definitely go back to Hotel Abbatial. The location is perfect (we saw nearly every neighborhood of the city in our stay, and feel that the Latin Quarter is by far the best if you like cafes on every corner, outdoor bars, book stores, flower shops, and a young but quiet feel to the neighborhood. It is close to Sorbonne University, so there are quite a lot of young people.)

Reviews.Title: “#1 Customer Service in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Troi R
Reviews.Content: Always a warm greeting at the front desk. Helpful with tourist questions. This is the 5th time we've stayed at the Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain and we wouldn't stay anywhere else. They go above and beyond to make you feel welcome. The rooms are tastefully decorated and have hot water kettles for tea and coffee. The location is great....metro, local market, great restaurants are all nearby. Notre Dame is only a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tim B
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Hotel Abbatial in September. We stayed in their triple room, room 61, and our stay was extremely enjoyable. There was plenty of room for two or three people. The exciting thing about this room is that it is down off it's own small hallway and therefore, there is no noise from any other rooms. We felt like we were on our own private floor. In addition, there are two windows with small balconies in the room. This allowed for nice fresh air circulation should you want it. There is a thermostat that is also easy to use if necessary (we didn't really need it). There is some city noise, sirens etc., but you have to expect that since you are in a city! Some people have complained or noted the church chiming across the street. It does chime, but we never heard it after 10 PM and never before 7:30 AM, so unless you sleep odd hours, it is not an issue. We took a couple of afternoon naps and had no problems sleeping. One other cool thing about the room is the view. There is a small balcony that one get a great view of Notre Dame. The balcony might be a bit hard to get up to for someone with limited mobility. It is about a one and a half foot step up from the floor of the room. We had a great time on sunny afternoons, just standing out there enjoying the sun and the sights. The beds and bathroom were great. I want to point out ...No bed bugs in this room, I checked when we first checked in. There is a very small elevator that holds about two people. The people at the front desk were very helpful and I had no trouble getting the free wifi set up on my netbook. The front desk had no trouble understanding English. We did not eat breakfast there, too many other places to get a quick bite to eat nearby, so I can not comment on that. The hotel is very easy to get to from the CDG airport. We just took the RER B to the St. Michel station and walked for about 10 minutes to the hotel. No sweat. The hotel location is great. Many shops for cheese, bread, deli meats, etc. nearby along with restaurants. There are even a couple of Franprixs within easy walking distance for groceries. The room had a very small fridge which was nice. We were a within easy walking distance of Notre Dame and the Seine. Easy walking distance to the Metro and from there all of Paris was easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Location is king!”
Reviews.Author: Kathybax
Reviews.Content: This has a perfectly grand location. We accidentally booked a standard sized room for half the time and a superior for the other half (long story). We got room 53. It has a double bed and is impossibly tiny. The narrow balcony from which you can see the top of Notre Dame does not compensate. My husband is 6'4" and we were just miserable in that bed. We moved to room 41 on day 4 and that was much better. Though only slightly bigger, there were two small beds pushed together, making for more sleeping space for long legs, and the configuration of the room worked so much better. We lost the view, but, boy was it worth it.. In general, the staff was very nice and helpful. I recommend this, but feel that most people would be pretty uncomfortable sharing a standard sized room. Go for the superior. If I were alone, it would have been fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: BettyBoopWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be near the Latin Quarter and this hotel seemed to fill the bill. There were 4 couples meeting and staying at this hotel and we were all pleased. The room that we requested for our 4 night stay is the room on the website (No. 44) and has two large window balconies that look onto St. Germain. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had the hotel breakfast once and altho overpriced as are most Paris hotel breakfasts, it was served in their lovely basement cavern and was more than enough to get us to lunch. Beds were comfortable and rooms came with kettle and coffee and tea supplies and room safe. We were about 2 blocks from Notre Dame and close to a metro stop. The front desk helped me hook up to their free internet and also let us gather our group together one evening in their lounge. We all enjoyed this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ohiotraveler037
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Abbatial for 5 days in September. Great location (2 blocks from Notre Dame) and great neighborhood. Rooms are a little on the small side, but that is typical for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: TurtleCat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the first weekend in September. I wrote ahead and asked for a top floor room with a balcony after reading reviews here. I was given room 53. It had a cute french iron balcony that had a view of Notre Dame! The room was basic but modern and clean. I have seen reviews that warn of bed bugs but I checked the room up and down and not only did not find a single sign of a bug, I noticed that thy had measure in place to discourage them as well. With bed bugs, you never know if the traveller brought them themselves if they had been at other hotels before this one. All in all, I would stay here anytime I am in Paris. The location is fantastic and as a solo traveller it was safe to walk around all hours of the night and not feel uncomfortable and one of my favorite things to do is sit in front of Notre Dame late at night and watch the street performers. I can't wait to go back to Paris and the Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain. I do agree that you should skip breakfast if it's not included, while I just loved the woman who works the cafe and she is more than happy to cook you eggs to your liking if you don't care for the runny scrambled you find all over Europe, you can get a better deal at the cafe's just outside.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tommiejay_ta
Reviews.Content: I heard a lot of horror stories about hotels in France. This one was fine though. The size of the room was fine, the bed was comfortable and all was clean. The AC worked well and the room was nice and cool at night. The front desk staff were friendly and there was 24 hour reception. Early check-in was not entertained. It didn’t matter to us as we only had a 2 hour flight to Paris but for someone arriving from the USA this may be inconvenient. The hotel is nicely located. Be aware that the street is quiet at night. Didn’t cause us any problem whatsoecer but some may not want to walk here alone late at night. I didn’t have the breakfast so I can’t comment. Mostly because it was served in the basement while the sun was shining outside. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paris. Just what we were looking for...”
Reviews.Author: citygrl63
Reviews.Content: We found this place at the last minute after a nightmare stay in the Bastille area. A friend had told me St. Germain was her favorite Paris neighborhood and now I see why. Hotel Abbatial is a small and charming French hotel. I'll admit, I'm an American who wants to experience all that Europe has to offer, but I don't want to sacrifice a comfortable bed and a clean and modern bathroom. Abbatial had the tiniest elevator and narrow hallways with exposed beams...our room wasn't large, but it looked out onto Parisian rooftops that were so straight out of a movie, I had to pinch myself to make sure I wasn't dreaming. On top of that, the staff was very helpful and friendly. Admittedly, ours was a last minute deal that was agreed upon by phone just hours before arriving. Well worth transferring from our previous hotel. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Service”
Reviews.Author: MissSoCal
Reviews.Content: After a long train rider from Holland my husband and I arrived at Abbatial Saint Germain late. When the gentleman at the Front Desk asked us if we had a reservation I showed him our online confirmation. He said he had nothing regarding our booking but knew our names since he had the paperwork right in front of him. He said we had to call the booking company and that he couldn't help us. We asked if we could pay for internet since we needed it to call the agency. He began yelling saying that it was for guests only. Since they had rooms available we asked if we could book the room directly and deal with the agency separate. He became very irate telling us that he could not help us and that we had to deal with our problem on our own. I have never been treated so badly by anyone in the hospitality industry. We ended up leaving since we couldn't stay in a place where the staff yells at guests and refuses to be helpful. Needless to say, everyone else we encountered in Paris was friendly and helpful. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL if you want a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: Pea18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in July. It was our first time in Paris so location was really important. We found that the hotel was a few minutes to many bakeries, markets, the metro and even Notre Dame. The room wasn't big but it was well laid out and very clean. We had a room on the top floor with a great little balcony that had really great views to the streets below. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel. We booked well in advance on their website and got a way better price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, and friendly staff & sufficient room, great price!”
Reviews.Author: CaptnToby
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the location and price! The room are sufficient, and neat. Can't compare to fancy hotel. But if is price and value for money, this is it. LOCATION is fantastic. Walking distance to Metro, local shops & great bakery right next door. We will definitely stay there again. Also thanks to the staff, they are friendly and helpful. We arrive pass midnight, and not problem with settling in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KerriMichele
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at your Hotel. Clean, tidy, staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We were very grateful for the 5th floor room that had the french doors and balcony....Fabulous! We loved the local charm. Close and convenient to food, shops and within walking distance to the charming sites of Paris. We would definately stay here again as long as we could have a balcony room! Thankyou!!

Reviews.Title: “A well located small hotel - recommended”
Reviews.Author: Efrony
Reviews.Content: We selected the 'superior room', though it was not as roomy as we expected it was sufficient for our needs. The room is equipped with a flat TV, air condition and a coffee set and it was always very clean. The hotel elevator, stairs, corridors are quite narrow. The breakfast was basic but includes all you need. The staff members were very kind and friendly. The location of the hotel is very good, a short walk to the trains stations (you can take a single train directly to the CDG air port), attractions, grocery shops, small and nice open market and even a public swimming pool is in a minute walk (we were there twice). There are also great restaurants in the area – we highly recommend the 'le petit pontoise', a classical French cooking. To summary – well located, clean, and decent – we probably will consider to stay here again it in our next visit in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good position, very clean”
Reviews.Author: GDavide85
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good position in Paris, close to metro station, and to the major attractions so you can walk to them. Crew is very nice and room (i booked a deluxe) was very nice and clean. no noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Shane W
Reviews.Content: I stay in Paris pretty frequently for business, and have stayed in many hotels in the area. I highly recommend Hotel Abbatail Saint Germain for the quality of room (good size, nice bathroom - for Paris standards). I stayed on the second floor, overlooking a side street, it was not noisy... The location cannot be beat, very close to the latin quarter and Notre Dame. Right across the street is a street market selling fresh bread, meat, cheese, wine - what else do you need? Not to mention, just a bit up the street is a subway station that connects to the airport. Easy in, easy out. The staff was extremely helpful as well, very courteous, always went the extra mile to give precise instruction in English. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: QUIGDEG
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at Hotel Abbatial in July 2011. It seemed better than a typical 3 star: great location, 24 hour concierge, helpful staff. We had the only 3 person room, 6th floor, with a "balcony" that afforded a view of Notre Dame, with a little neck turning. Room was recently renovated, comfortably accommodated 3 women, full bath, A/C, very comfortable beds. We were pleasantly surprised as we didn't see the hotel mentioned in any guide book and found it online as we searched for affordable rooms for 3 people. Hotel is continuing its renovation process, but we didn't experience any inconvenience because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in beautiful paris”
Reviews.Author: soapieAuckland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Abbatial for 3 nights and had a fantastic time - we got a deluxe room on the 5th floor. The room was large, nicely decorated with a huge comfy bed with nice linens. The bathroom was again a very good size, very modern with a shower over the bath. The best part was the huge wraparound balcony overlooking st germain - there was even a door from the bathroom onto the balcony. It was great to spend time looking out over the local area from the balcony and we even had a view of notre dame. The location is fantastic and the local restaurants, bakeries and shops were lovely. Would definitely stay at this hotel again - really enjoyed the location, the stylish room and the fantastic balcony.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in the late quarter”
Reviews.Author: squizzi1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the deluxe rooms at the Hotel Abbatial. The rooms were quite small (as most European rooms are) but well appointed and very comfortable. The front desk staff were lovely and nothing was too much for them. The hotel was very close to the metro and near plenty of lovely patisseries and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - highly recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: SueJan_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain in June 2011. The hotel was clean, the staff - from the front desk to the breakfast room - were friendly and helpful, and the location couldn't be beat. My room looked onto the 'courtyard' so there was no view - but I was not in the room for a view. I slept well, and one foot outside and you're in the middle of fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: aroundtheworld011
Reviews.Content: Just a block from the Notre Dame Cathedral, the location is the reason you stay here. The rooms are on the smaller side, but not as small as many other budget-conscious european hotel rooms. The price is very good for Paris and the service was very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel for the proximity to the cafe lined streets of the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame and many other sights. We easily walked to the Luxemburg Gardens, Louvre, and Invilades.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for Paris - and great location”
Reviews.Author: Ruth78London
Reviews.Content: Paris is a difficult place to find good value for money and although this wasn't the most glamorous place I've ever stayed, it was certainly great value. The rooms are tastefully decorated (browns and creams), clean and the beds are comfortable. And the location is fantastic. Just across from the Metro where there's a little produce market and plenty of bars and restaurants. If you're after a fun, cheap night out then head up the hill past the universities there's plenty to choose from, and much cheaper than the more touristy areas like St Michel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location, rooms were great and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Chazwazza
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in April, my sister and brother in law also stayed here for 2 nights. We had originally booked for 6 nights, but found a really good deal online for a 4 star hotel a street away from the Champs Elysees. The cancellation process for the last 3 nights was easily done online. We both booked Superior rooms, and my booking does say with bath - but we only got a shower. Not sure what happened there - but in the end it didn't matter, the shower was fantastic. The cubicle itself was large and the water pressure/heat was just right. The rooms, as you would expect in Paris, are not large at all - we didn't really have any room to put our bags (which is always a pain) but we did get rooms on Rue St Germain side and both rooms had 2 French doors going to a private little balcony. The best thing about this hotel is the location. I loved that you walk down one little side street beside the hotel and there is Notre Dame right in front of you - how fantastic! There are so many restaurants in the area, a laundromat a few streets away - and the Maubert market on Saturdays is small but great. We bought some little jams, mustards, scarves and the yummiest strawberries I have ever tasted there. There is a little cafe right beside the hotel that does take away coffees. Also there are a few bakeries very close by, including Eric Kayser a street away. The staff were very friendly, when we got to the hotel and were definitely there if we had any questions. They spoke very good English as well. Overall we had a great stay, and I recommend this hotel to other travellers. When we go back to Paris, this will be our first choice for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a first trip to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: uofagirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights in May 2011 and were very pleased with the hotel. I had requested a "quieter" room since I'm a light sleeper and we were given a room on the 5th floor facing an interior courtyard (not pretty and without a view unlike the street view rooms but very quiet). Our room had somewhat of an awkward layout but there was enough space for our luggage. We appreciated the free wi-fi, safe, and the mini fridge. The bathroom was a good size and I love bathrooms that have natural light (ours had big double windows with frosted glass). The bath products provided smelled wonderful and I'm looking into purchasing some for home use. We ate breakfast there 3 times and thought it was a fair deal (12 Euro/person) for what we got (buffet style scrambled eggs, sausage, assorted breads and some pastries, yogurt, fruit, juice, coffee, cheese, etc). We usually filled up and saved some money by having a light lunch. The location was pretty good but we may look for a place slightly more east down Saint Germain next time we visit just for a change. There's a small market practically across the street and Rue Mouffetard is within walking distance. On our last day, we almost missed our train back to London and had to take a taxi instead of the RER (as we had originally planned) and the taxi was only 13Euro to Gare Nord (there's a taxi stand just down the street from the hotel). The only negative thing we experienced were noisy hotel guests that stayed across from our room. I think it was a couple of younger females (or maybe not) but the first few nights we were there, they would return to the hotel at 2am and were loud (in the hallway and in their room...we could hear them in their room talking). I was tempted to go over the third night to tell them to be mindful of other guest but decided to just let it go. Overall I would say this was a very, very nice hotel that provided a great base to see Paris for first time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Charming rooms, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: hayjay21
Reviews.Content: I arrived quite late - around 10pm - and they checked me in quickly and easily. The gentleman at the front desk was very nice and his English was excellent. They set me up with wireless right away, and they put me in a room on the 6th (top) floor, which I recommend. The room was the perfect size - remember, this is Paris - and even had a little balcony that I could stand out on and see the lights of Paris. There is a lovely church right across the street, and you can see the Pantheon and even a tiny Eiffel Tower from the room. The Notre Dame was just a few blocks away, as was the Metro station. There were lovely cafes, etc all around, and I didn't opt to get the 12 euro breakfast because I could get myself a croissant and cafe au lait down the street for half that. The stay was just lovely and I'll be staying there again when I return. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great rooms and service, very good value!”
Reviews.Author: cparisgirl
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Abbatial on our Trip of a Lifetime Part Deux :-) and we couldn't have been more satisfied. Our room was on the 5th floor and had THREE french windows which opened out on to a balcony - two overlooked the Blvd St. Germain, and one had a view of Notre Dame! The bathroom was very nice and modern. The staff were very nice. They made several reservations for me before we arrived in Paris, which helped greatly. Even though you don't spend a lot of time in your room in Paris, a good hotel and nice room can really make your trip... this one definately did!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, moderately priced, well located small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TMitch6542
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Paris and I stayed at this hotel for two nights. I would describe this hotel as a nice, small boutique type hotel that is very well located. It is a three star, and I think that is about right. It is clean,and our room (#22 - a deluxe twin) wasn't large, by any means, but certainly large enough for two of us and our luggage with plenty of space to walk around. It has a desk area and a coffee pot was also provided. The bathroom is updated and not large, but not tiny either. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on that, but the desk staff were friendly enough, but I woudn't call them service oriented. They were happy to help you when asked, but they didn't volunteer a lot of information. We got what I felt was a very reasonable rate on the hotel's website and from what I have seen, I think this hotel is very reasonably priced. The location is great for walking in the Latin Quarter and Saint Germain area, and there is a metro stop about a block away. There are plenty of bars and cafes around. Also across the street, there are vegetable, meat, cheese,etc. shops and on Tuesdays (and two other days if I recall) there is a small outdoor market selling everthing from food, fresh fish, clothing, some leather goods etc. My one complaint would be that the street traffic can be quite noisy at night if you want to sleep with the windows open.

Reviews.Title: “What a let-down! Avoid this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Nflann
Reviews.Content: Following 2 email correspondences requesting a double room with a balcony and view of the boulevard 2 months in advance of our arrival I was most disappointed to be assigned a room on the 1st floor overlooking a dark narrow courtyard. Was assured by the night porter there would be no problem being assigned a different room the folllowing morn as plenty of ppl were checking out in the morning and that there would be many rooms available. However the lady at the front desk was most insistent that we could change rooms. Our room was dark, tiny-we needed the light on in The morning despite it being sunny and 24 degrees outside. Our bed was 2 singles pushed together!! I cannot say that i found the front desk staff unfriendly and cold. cleaning staff are very noisy in the morning. Avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: JuddyDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed here with other adults, we booked to stay here with our 2 children aged 10 and 8. We had 2 interconnecting double rooms and got a really good deal for a 3 night stay booking direct with the hotel on the internet. The rooms are small but adequate, recently decorated with excellent ensuite shower rooms. The service was very frinedly both to us and to our daughters. The best thing about the hotel is the location almost right opposite Notre Dame on the left bank. We were able to walk to the Louvre, the Musee D'Orsay, Pompidou Centre, Arc de Triomphe without any difficulty.They offer a buffet breakfast for 12 euros which we didn't try. Instead we walked along the road and had a continental breakfast for 7 euros at "Le Twickenham" which despite it's name is a very typical Parisian cafe-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: edham
Reviews.Content: We travelled to this Hotel to meet up with family. The lobby area was small but suited our group of 6 for meeting up & discussing our plans for the day. The Hotel is so ideally situated to access the open-topped tour buses, the river boats, the trains & the metro. The reception staff were very friendly, making us all feel welcome by remembering our room door numbers. We had a lovely room - the only complaint was that the duvet was too heavy! The tea & coffee making is very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dallas1552
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was very cute and cozy. The only problem I found was the tightness of the bathroom, but it was very clean. You kinda have to be careful getting in and out because the tub is kinda high and you have to reach behind the glass wall to turn on the shower. You cannot move the glass out of the way, because the toilet is to close. If you are a big person this is really an inconvienence and the only support you have to grab to hold onto is a towel rack. The carpet is very 1970's. The elevator is big enough for 2 people and no luggage or you need to let 1 person and 1 piece of luggage go up at a time. The front desk folks were very nice and helpful, especially Veronique. You're located in the Latin Quarter and close to everything. We walked to Louvre and the Eiffel Tower in about an hour. The Notre Dame is about 5 or 6 minutes away and so is the Pantheon. Our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Gajo2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 6 nights. Comfortable and clean rooms. Well presented. Great bathrooms, showers. Two short blocks from Metro Line 10 (Maubert-Mutualite), which is the location of a wonderful open-air market on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday (Marche Maubert). Friendly staff. Toiletries (shampoo, soap, conditioner) not placed in room every day. Had to request them twice. Television never worked the entire week so I couldn't keep up with news/weather reports. Front desk clerk was asleep on the sofa (totally stretched out with pillow and blanket) in the lobby when I came downstairs at 5:45 a.m. one day. Maybe it's allowed, I don't know, Even with the toiletries and TV issues, I'd stay there again but would make it clear upon check-in that I want a room with a working TV, and I would let the houseekeeper know that toiletries must be placed in my room every day.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lawin4cr
Reviews.Content: First, the location....could not have been better. Minutes from major sites. Hotel is on major street in Paris full of life and traffic. Front desk staff was so helpful, especially the man at night. After traveling from the US, we arrived early in the morning. The staff allowed us to leave our luggage in a waiting room and to use the wireless internet even thou we had not checked in. They kept us aprised of our room and as soon as it was ready they let us check in. I have to say, traveling all over Europe, I was prepared for a small room...tho nothing this small! The room truly could not have been more than 11X11. That said, it was clean and comfortable. We struggled with luggage placement but with some carefully organized planning, the room worked. We were in room #51, which was the smallest on the floor it appeared. No real extras here, but again...the location! Be sure to try a restaurant around the corner called Le Petit Pontoise. Exit the hotel, go to the left one block, make another left. It's right there an can't be missed!! Excellent staff who make Americans feel welcome! Another great place is Eric Kayser for fresh pastry. I hit this place every morning! Back to the hotel. There is a small refridgerator in the room that is stocked, I emptied it out and went across the street to a small market for soda, water and snacks. The refridgerators are not real cold, so you need to keep things in there for a while for them to become chilled. For some reason, in Europe nothing is cold and they do not believe in ice! In fact, I think they enjoy saying "no" when you ask for extra, more, or even some!!! TV in each room, hair dryer, etc. Cleaning lady was very nice, be sure to tip on your first few days so they remember you!!! Stay at this place if you want to be near the Latin Quarter and a very nice part of Paris. Very close to the Metro, which you must use!!! Easy to get around Paris on the Metro. I would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here when you visit Paris”
Reviews.Author: carolann6003
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel would be enough of a reason to recommend it to fellow travelers but add in modern bathrooms, beautifully decorated (but small) rooms, a very nice breakfast and wonderful staff. This was my second stay here and will definitely stay here again. If you are lucky enough to get a room on the fifth floor, especially those facing St. Germaine Blvd, the rooms have balconies, a view of the Pantheon and gorgeous sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkyeRich
Reviews.Content: First time ever in Paris, directions were simple for finding the hotel. Checking in easy and up on the cutest lift ever. Room small but quiet, until opening the 'balcony doors'. The noise of Paris flooded in, I could have spent hours leaning out. Close to Notre Dame and St Germain is such an interesting area. The hotel was a great place to launch from. The cafe underneath sold great coffee. Made this kiwi happy as a pig in [--]. Nice to have a safe secure base to see one of the greatest cities in Europe from.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & well-situated”
Reviews.Author: Belgo43
Reviews.Content: Rooms well-decorated and clean, breakfast OK, service OK, very well situated next to metro. Rooms and bathrooms small but this is Paris after all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really friendly and helpful staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ivv310
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel close to a lot of great landmarks. The people at the front desk were wonderful and the rooms are really clean and modern. Only complaint is that the beds are TINY... and if you come back to the hotel past like 12 they lock the front door and you have to ring the bell 50x before the sleeping man at the front desk wakes up to let you in:)

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: littlejohn46
Reviews.Content: We were here in 2009 and promise we would return again and yes we did. The improvements are fantastic. Bedrooms now have a De luxe room which we took and it is well worth the extra euro. Large room queen sized bed, fridge , safe , tea /coffee making facilities, wi fi, the bathroom was bigger than some of the rooms we had stayed in other hotels. Excellent breakfeast, superb staff, spotless in every respect. Thank you Veronique for a fantastic time with you. One small point : whilst there is wi fi throughout , there is no internet facility available , and there are no internet cafes in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great position and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dlm45
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son from 10-13 January 2011. We found that this hotel was in a terrific position - close to everything, including the Metro and major sights. Breakfast at Eric Kayser, just a block away, was terrific and convenient. When we checked in we had been allocated a room that had a king size bed instead of 2 singles. We were very quickly moved (and upgraded) to a room with 2 beds. The manager was also very helpful in assisting us with a shuttle to airport as we had an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: LEH1964
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. The staff are genuinely nice and extremely helpful, the rooms are quite nicely decorated and up-to-date and the location is perfectly situated. I've stayed at quite many hotels in the Saint-Germain Des Pres area, my favorite in Paris, and this one is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Accomidating Staff & Wonderful View”
Reviews.Author: okie_dokie_smokie
Reviews.Content: Paris was the last stop on our trip following up Amsterdam & Brussels. The Abbatial Saint Germain was a breath of fresh air. Through we did splurge from our normal, budget hotel rates, this hotel was still reasonably priced, located close to lots of wonderful sight seeing. In addition, directly our our street-side, private balcony was a view of the Panteon, and around the corner was Notre Dame. In the mornings, there is a fresh market down the street as well. The staff was very accommodating even arranging transportation for us to the airport. Though the elevator is (as mentioned by other reviews) very small, we opted to use the stairs more often than not, and left the elevator for those who needed it most. I would defiantly recommend Abbatial Saint Germain to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Stop researching and stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: kathd113
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of our honeymoon and we really enjoyed it. Rooms are clean, comfortable and the bathroom was quite spacious. We had the best nights sleep in their big comfy beds!There is a lift which is on the small size but my husband and I managed to squeeze ourselves, 2 suitcases and 2 hand luggage. The reception staff are very helpful and they organised an airport transfer for us to Orly so we wouldn't have to navigate the metro with lots of luggage. We didn't have the breakfast as it was a bit pricey. We walked up the street to an unbelievable patisserie - La Parisienne. So affordable, we paid less than 5 euros for both of us to have breakfast (croissants, croque monsieur etc). Its a block and a half up the road. The hotel is unbelievably close to Notre Dame - take a shortcut up one of the streets to save you time. The metro is very close too. All in all, we had a great honeymoon and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere, great location, good value, friendly caring staff”
Reviews.Author: nerd02
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend it. I stayed 5 nights, and found Abbatial a comfortable, secure, affordable home. The staff treat you like a great friend who has come to stay--they offer concierge services. I tried the 12-euro breakfast only once: croissants, etc and coffee are great but also cereal, canned fruit cocktail and fake-seeming scrambled eggs. Very clean, warm, lots of towels, excellent discreet maid service.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: FB_Dub
Reviews.Content: Arrived in CDG and took the train to St Michel Notre Dame. The hotel is only 10 mins from the station. Upon entering the room we were pleasantly suprised with the size of the room as we had read about the small sizes of rooms in Paris hotels. The room had a lovely bed(two singles joined well together), exposed wooden beams and a balcony overlooking the Bvld St Germain. Traffic noise was no problem as the windows were double glazed. Location was prefect. Very close to Notre Dame and to a number of Metro stops. Would recommend the hotel to anybody. Did not have brekfast in the hotels so can not comment on this

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: loolie
Reviews.Content: I was pleased overall with the hotel. Rooms are very small however this is to be expected in Paris, the bed was nice and comfortable and the room was clean. There was however only one towel in our room when we arrived so requested more and we were given one more towel. The following moring, in the middle of my morning shower the water turned cold which can be quite annoying when you have a head full of shampoo. A call to reception fixed the problem and it didn't happen again. Location was also good, plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. Overall experience was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “what a lovely surprise!”
Reviews.Author: little78
Reviews.Content: what a great surprise it was. i traveled to Paris with my partner, for a romantic vacation, we booked abbatial hotel after reading some good reviews here, and walking into the room was so good! the room was spacious, very clean, staff at the desk were very nice every time we needed something or had questions, the location is simply amazing! just 10 minutes walk from the Notre-dame cathedral, a metro station close by, and so many restaurants, bistro's, food and wine shops, and whatever it is that you need/want. we had a reservation for the bath-tab- room, and it is very much recommanded. i would'nt choose any other hotel on my next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: pmrichard00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Abbatial for 5 nights recently (12/12-12/17) ~ room 32 (with 2 very small but very cute balconies). Excellant location, 3 blocks from Notre Dame and Isle d' Saint Louis. Restaurants, shopping, wine/cheese shops and bakeries are very close by. The hotel was VERY clean and the staff was friendly and helpful (especially Veronique!!). The only drawback is that it is a bit noisy in the rooms (could hear plumbing and TV from other rooms). Would DEFINITELY stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: hankli
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and his parents. They had never been to France and spoke no French. All were warmly greeted and well taken care of. Breakfasts were excellent! Rooms are small but this was no problem for us since we travel light and were out and about all day. Loved the toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: camjdw
Reviews.Content: Great location, very close to metro station. Just a few minutes walk from Notre Dame and numerous restaurants and shops. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. Our room on the fifth floor had a nice terrace from which we could see the top of Notre Dame. The room was a good size and the shower had good water pressure. No complaints. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: honest_reviewer_543
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abbatial Saint Germain for three nights. The rooms are pretty small but that's to be expected in Paris. The room was very clean and the staff was friendly. The beds were a bit hard but not uncomfortable. The best part was the free WiFi which is hard to come by in Paris. The location is excellent, you are a few minutes from Notre Dame and not too far from the subway. The area in general has a ton of restaurants and cafes but it's not overly touristy. It felt like the upper East Side of Manhattan vs. being in Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Saffidon
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't be much better - a short walk from Notre Dame, the Pompidou and other attractions. Overall it was a nice stay and I found the chap staff very helpful and friendly. It was nice to have a balcony and the room was comfortable. There were a few little issues - the wall outside our room had been stripped to the plaster so it looked a bit untidy. The shower door was hanging off, and the wifi was not working, which caused me a lot of inconvenience. The climate control was also set, and it was quite hot in the room (and it was winter!). Our room was very small, but it did have a small balcony which you could stand on for some fresh air. Mainly it was clean, but there was a slightly unpleasant stain on the carpet. All in all I would recommend it, but perhaps for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: JudyD58
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Paris with 3 friends - none of us had ever been there before. We found the Abbatial to be an excellent place to stay for 8 days. Pertfect location, only a block from the Seine where we used the Batabus hop-on-off water taxi to get around all week. Our staff at the hotel couldn't have been nicer - even booked a couple side trips for us. Our rooms were immaculate and when we had a problem with plumbing in the bathroom they had a repairman there in 5 minutes to fix it. We had breakfast each morning at the hotel and were pleasantly greeted by a wonderful staff. We were in Paris during the week of strikes and high alert but we never felt threatened. The French people as a whole were very friendly and helpful to us and I look forward to returning to Paris and the Abbatial Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shhh - don't tell anyone else!!”
Reviews.Author: LvsChagall
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Perfect location, about two blocks from a Metro station - 5-10 min walk from Notre Dame - Incredible staff - they really couldn't of been nicer, - the front desk sfaff, incredibly helpful, speaks very good English - the breakfast staff, so welcoming every morning - everyone we came in contact with. Yes, the rooms are small, but very clean - refridgerators, coffee-maker - nice clean bathrooms. well outfitted - really this hotel is a gem -- I just hate to tell you all about it because then it will be hard to book - Elevator is tiny so be prepared for 1 person at a time with luggage but really - who cares, your in Paris!!! After trying other places for breakfast we decided the great 12 Euro breakfast was worth every penny. Highly, highly recommend this hotel for nice, clean accomodations in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Jacquelyn42
Reviews.Content: I stayed in October 2010 for 4 nights with my husband. We were looking for a hotel that was near the Latin Quarter so that we would be near the centre and able to walk out at night to a restaurant and not have to take a taxi or public transport. The hotel was in a great location near Notre Dame within easy walking distance of the Ile de la Cite. The room was clean and comfortable with a good breakfast area in the basement. There were numerous restaurants nearby and the metro station was only a short walk away. The area felt safe even at night. The only negative was that the safe in the room was broken but reception said that a new one had been ordered. Would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Pearl_006_10
Reviews.Content: I was traveling alone in Paris for 6 days and wanted a safe, cozey place to come home to each night. This hotel certainly accomplished that. My room was very quiet and clean. Lots of places to unpack your things and really feel at home. The hotel is in the PERFECT location. You can walk almost anywhere from here and you are surrounded by lots of wonderful cafes. As people have said, skip the hotel breakfast as it is a bit over priced, not mention you can walk one block, spend less, and enjoy a parisian cafe. I found it fairly easy to get from CDG to the hotel using only public transportation and walking. The staff was great and when I decided stay an extra night they booked me a larger room at their sister hotel right across the street for the same price (they were all booked up). Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: mfinley_005
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain lived up to the prior reviews provided on the tripadvisor site. The location in the Latin Quarter was perfect for us. We could easily walk to several key attractions (Seine, Notre Dame, Cluny). Our room on the 5th floor had a small balcony from which we could see the steeple and bell tower of Notre Dame. The room itself was quite nicely laid out in the space provided (not huge, but certainly not a sardine can) and the bath/shower was quite nice. The staff was very friendly and welcoming and spoke very fluent English (although they were very polite about letting us try to use as much French as we were able). We were concerned about leaving out on the 12th, the date of a scheduled strike, and the receptionist was very helpful in reserving us seats on an airport shuttle. We would definitely stay at Hotel Abbatial again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: ncman21
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain is conveniently located in the Latin Quarter, a few blocks from the St. Michel-Notre Dame station. The staff was helpful and pleasant and the room was reasonable, by French standards, in size and amenities. However, our first floor room was located above the side street and was quite noisy well through the night on most of the six evenings we spent there. Perhaps a higher floor would have resulted in a quieter experience.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff in a clean hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: millydo2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in a double room,3rd floor,good size,nice bathroom.Helpful staff on reception 24hrs,Laundromat across the road,close to metro and quick taxi ride to Gare du Lyon for TGV to other destinations.Cafe next door great for a beer at the end of a days walking!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Old Friends”
Reviews.Author: Burlington-Bob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first time in October of 2008 on our honeymoon. The location and the people at the service desk are what brought us back. They remembered me when I called to reserve the rooms and were very obliging in giving us the rooms on the floor we requested (5th floor) with small balconies. We were greeted by the woman who runs the breakfast room like old friends. She even remember how I like my tea. The location on boulevard St. Germain is excellent. The Metro stop is a block away. We thoroughly enjoyed our 9 day stay. The room was comfortable and well appointed. We had a very nice bathroom with hand held shower. The air conditioning was very good as we had unseasonably warm weather. We would turn it off on cooler days and open the window to the balcony. Rooms are much smaller in Europe than in North America but the room was more than adequate with a large closet and desk. The elavator in the hotel is very compact but fine for 2 people. The optional breakfast was well worth the money. Some days there are open air markets accross the street. We will go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Need I Say More?”
