Reviews.Author: Vicsite
Reviews.Content: So you can probably tell from the other reviews that this is a small hotel in a great location. Here's a tip: skip their expensive breakfast and go to the Eric Kayser bakery instead (on Rue Monge). If you need a big cup of coffee, there's a Starbucks on St. Michel. Then eat your breakfast in the Cluny park or on the pedestrian bridge across to Notre Dame. It's the perfect way to start your day in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good stay”
Reviews.Author: JimnArizona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abbatial St Germain for 5 nights and had a good stay. Our room was on the 5th floor, had a small balcony and a nice view of the Pantheon. Room was small but we unpacked into the closets and stashed the suitcases in the corner and did just fine. Location is terrific, blocks from Nortre Dame, metro and many dining options at the doorstep and just 10 minutes from the frantic madness of the Latin Quarter retaurant rows. Easy walking distance to the Cluny museum. On a busy street but we never really noticed any excess noise, just the normal city sounds. Staff not the most knowledgeable but always friendly and all were multi lingual. This is a large, mid-tier urban hotel so do not expect the level of attention you get from a botique hotel or a 5 star chain. Solid affordable (for Paris) choice. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great price”
Reviews.Author: WrldHrtgSighter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in March. We were very pleased with our stay. The room was comfortable, clean and nicely decorated. I think our room number was 409, which seemed like one of the larger rooms on our floor. The location was great, with plenty of shops, restaurants and metro stations nearby. We even recommended this hotel to my in-laws when they went to Paris in June, and they enjoyed their stay, too. My only recommendation would be to make sure you pack a clock with an alarm, because there wasn't one in the room and we didn't get a wake-up call the first day we requested one (the other four days we did, though).

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynBruin
Reviews.Content: Super close to the Metro (Maubert-Mutualite stop) and the RER B to go to Versailles (St. Michel-Notre Dame stop). 5 minute walk to Ile St. Louis or Notre Dame and the Seine. Also, in a fantastic neighborhood which felt safe and chic. A few blocks from bars, cafes, restaurants. The room itself was clean. We were in Room 66 on the top floor with a small balcony that had a view of the church on Blvd. St. Germain. Elevator was tiny but serviceable. Small hotel so rarely had to wait very long for the elevator. Rooms were small, but as expected. Never tried the breakfast because of the many choices nearby. Went to Eric Kayser on 8 Rue Monge (one block away) nearly everyday to get croissants and baguettes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JME1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Abbatial Saint Germain in Sept 2010; The location is great- walking distance to Notre Dame, the Seine, and the Metro. The staff was courteous and helpful, and the rooms were clean and spacious compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Europe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Parisienne-great location-small but modern”
Reviews.Author: tripette77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a romantic weekend in Paris Sept 9-13 and stayed at the Hotel Abbatial St Germain. It was lovely. It was in the St Germain district on Boulevard St Germain (a major street with shops and easy Metro access) which I highly recommend. This area is lively and one block from both the Sienne River and Notre Dame, as well as tons of cafes and nightlife. The staff bent over backward to help us with booking tours, getting directions and making dinner recommendations. We actually two rooms there-our first night we were on the 2nd floor facing the courtyard. this room was very modern. The next day and for the remainder of our stay they put us on the 5th floor which had a beautiful balcony and view of the city. The only issue is the bed was much more uncomfortable here. The only thing I was note is this hotel is not for the handicapped - the elevator is very very small and hallways are narrow. But if you are able and want a lovely location that is bustling and lively, this is the place for you. We paid about $195 USD per night for a "deluxe double" - room for two people with a single bed directly on the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sbpwilliams
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Paris. The previous 2 times we have stayed at different hotels. We decided to stay in the Latin Quarter this time & discovered this little gem. We were in room 507. There is no getting away from the fact that the room is small but it it perfectly formed. The room is modern & packed with style. The balcony was brilliant. Excellent views also. The shower was amazing. Truely the best shower I have had in a hotel. The entire stay was so relaxing. Had the best nights sleep. I would deffinetly stay again. Try the Macaroons - Bliss!!! Only 1 minus. We arrived too early for our 14:00 check in. We thought there would be a secure room to keep our bags in. We were directed to an area just off reception that is a general seating area. Here is where we had to leave our bags. Not secure but we trusted the system & it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “The first Paris hotel we would ever stay at again”
Reviews.Author: Cyndye
Reviews.Content: We've traveled in France many, many times and because of our bad experiences with Paris hotels, we started renting apartments for the weeks we were in Paris. On our last trip, we needed to stay in a hotel and so we made reservations at the Abbatial Saint-Germain. Rooms 25, 35, and 45 (I think) are very large -- with bath tubs. My parents and my brother and his wife stayed in 25 and 35, we were in 16, which is small but very nice. The concierges were delightful and all spoke English, which was good for my parents and brother,since they speak no French. The breakfasts were good, too: eggs, juice, yogurt, croissants, pain au chocolate. cheese plate, butter, jams, and all the coffee you can drink, as well as hot chocolate. The shampoos and other soaps really made showering a pleasure. Centrally located and close to the nice food shops, plus Franprix on Place Maubert, as well as the metro. We will go back to the Abbatial whenever we need to stay in a hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sundae1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in late August. It is located in a sensational position, close to Notre dame, restaurants and railway stations. There was also a laundromat across the road which came in handy. The room was comfortable and clean and the ambience of the hotel was perfect for Paris. We would not want anything more. My only suggestions is that the hotel consider decreasing the price of breakfast as we were the only ones there each day and perhaps put on wine and cheese in the afternoons. With breakfast, there were cheaper options outside of the hotel and for a few euros less am sure that more people would dine in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: original_peach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Abbatial at the beginning of Aug and throughly recommend this hotel. The location is great, a short walk from the Metro, local shops and restuarants and site seeing. The rooms are small but just the right size for a short stay. We had a balcony with a nice view which you can see the top of Notre Dame from. I didn't have breakfast here, but there are local patisseries where you can pick something up for a few euros, so there's no need really. This was a lovely hotel, quaint not OTT and i would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The cherry on top of an amazing stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Blue2118
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a perfect little gem situated so close to the Notre Dame. Everything is so close and the place is surrounded with shops, cafe's and all of the charms that makes Paris beautiful. The rooms: They were small but for the money totally worth it. The rooms were always clean and the bathroom was very nice too. The view from our room looked out on to a little parisian street and we could just see the Saint Germain. There was minimal noise, if any, from traffic. The food: I can't comment on this as we didnt stay for breakfast, however, it's practically in the centre so a charming Parisian cafe is around every corner. Location: It couldn't have been better. Everything was just a walk away. It's close to the italian quarter so it's close to lots of bars, restaurants and cafes. And, everything else is literally just within walking distance. We didn't use our tube passes once apart from to get to the train station way up north and to the Moulin Rouge. In conclusion, it was just perfection and the staff were so friendly and always had a smile on their faces!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: mariebnaughton
Reviews.Content: Located a stones throw from Notre Dame. Our rooms was ample in size for the location and spotlessly clean, as was the bathroom. Beds were made up daily and towels replaced. The buffet breakfast was well worth the €12 extra charge and served by friendly lady in a relaxed atmosphere. This was my third trip to Paris and I will definitely stay here again. The only negative comment I have was the absence tea/coffee making facilities in the room, although it didn't bother me personally my traveling companion missed it. I'd be delighted to recommendi Hotel Abbatial to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Frankie011
Reviews.Content: Clean, simple hotel. Rooms small but with all mod cons. and very comfortable. The breakfast is adequate with cereal, rolls and bread, cheese and jams. Also scrambled eggs. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location couldn't be better as you turn the corner you see Notre Dam. The lift was not working whilst we were there which was a big minus but I would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Paris Vacation”
Reviews.Author: RubenMexico
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel, Rooms are clean, Air Conditioning is Excellent, Breakfast is OK for French breakfast even better than OK. Room size for the small rooms is the standard for Paris (small) but OK the higher level the rooms are great. Location is incredible you can’t ask for a lot better Metro 2 minutes away, Notredam 3 minutes away, Rue Rivoly and Hotel the Ville 7 minutes away, Marco at the front desk is a great service provider and was helpful with any and all our needs. Very recommended and will go there again, we traveled as a family 2+2.

Reviews.Title: “We just spent four nights in August”
Reviews.Author: Irvine92606
Reviews.Content: This great little hotel has exceeded my expectations! We stayed in a name brand more expensive 4-star hotel for two nights before this one (because we were with a tour group and that was the assigned hotel), Hotel Abbatial is better managed, in a better location, and overall a better value. We stayed on the 2nd floor, Room 23, facing the main street. The room size is small, not much spare floor space but it's perfectly adequate for two people. The bathroom is modern and appears new. Housekeeing does a very good job. I'm picky on cleaniness and this hotel is very clean. I vaguely sense some Japanese inspired influence here and there. Staff speak excellent English. Courteous and helpful. The hotel has free wi-fi. Everywhere we stayed in Europe, we had to pay extra for internet access (typically 10-20 euro for one day access). It's easy to go from the hotel to CDG. We took the shuttle arranged by the hotel. 17 euro per person. If you want to use the train you can, we just didn't feel like dragging our luggage. The hotel is located near Metro stop Maubert-Mutualité on line 10. The reception gave us a tourist map upon arrival. The Metro is very easy to use. However, we mainly walked. The best feature of the hotel is its location. It's very close to Notre Dame and Seine. We also walked to Louvre. Basically many major sights along the Seine River you can walk to within 20 minutes or so. The hotel is also very close to Pantheon and Sorbonne in the other direction. You can also walk to shopping in St. Germain (6th). I did my shopping at the Louis Vuitton store there. There are tons of restaurants, cafes, and food stalls nearby. Excellent food at reasonable prices. Near Effel Tower we saw 7 euro sugar crepes. The same crepe (but bigger and better made) in the Latin Quarter (near the hotel) costs 1.5 euro. If I have to pick on something. I would say that we did hear street sounds. It doesn't bother us, but if you are a light sleeper, you may want to request a room not facing the street, or a room on a higher floor. Overall, this hotel is an excellent value. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and friendly, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sknallt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night in august. First of all it is very clean and the staff is friendly. The room size depends on the room number (15 is a little bit smaller than the rest, but more than enough). The bathrooms are also nice and new. It is a very close walk to notre dame and the next metro station. We also had the breakfast for 12€. There are not so many different things, but all you need and the quality is excellent. We think it is worth 12€. We booked online (around 3 months before) and paid only half the price given at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “I just spent three nights at this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: SR0279
Reviews.Content: I just spent three nights at this hotel. The room was much nicer than I expected. It was very clean and modern. It was small, but perfectly standard as hotel rooms go in Paris. The hotel is located just minutes from the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame and the metro. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price/Quality Ratio”
Reviews.Author: neets_25
Reviews.Content: If you are budget-minded but don't want to compromise on quality (safety, cleanliness, location) this might be the hotel for you. Let me qualify by adding that we were able to take advantage of the online 3-night package, so our room came out to 100 euros a night. There was hardly any other hotel that offered similar quality at this price during the high-season. The hotel is very central. A stone's-throw from the metro system, and a 5-min walk from the RER B (goes to airport) and RER C (goes to Versailles). Our room came with a private safe, so we did not have to worry about important belongings. It also had a mini-bar fridge, so we were able to cram-in some cheeses, fruit, juice and yogurt. This was very important for us, since eating out in Paris is extremely expensive and grocery/market shopping, at least for some meals, is the key to saving money. It is also the more romantic option. Anywhere along La Seine river and right by The Effiel Tower, Parisians and tourists alike picnic. Bring a thin sheet to eat or sit on. The Notre-Dame Basilica along La Seine river (at least one of, or thee most beautiful spot in Paris) is a 2-min walk from the hotel. We regret a few things after our trip to Paris, like to going to Versailles (not worth the money and time in my opinion) and not having time left to dedicate an afternoon walking around Montmartre district (absolutely charming), but our choice of hotel did not disappoint. *Room: was smallish (but also typical of Paris) and carpeted. Bathroom was a good size though. Good balcony. We had room #53 on the fifth floor - top storey. **Food in the area: Picnic-friendly! An outdoor market (Market Mutualite) on select days and time. Bakery, butcher and cheese shop very close by and next to each other. Great Asian (Vietnamese) restaurant in the area on the busy intersection closest to the hotel. I can't remember the name, but you can't miss or mistake it. There is a huge outdoor terasse at the bottom of some stairs. I had a bowl called Bo-Bens at 12 euros, which is what many people around us were eating. Very yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, flawless hotel”
Reviews.Author: billandnana
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Abbatial St. Germain in Paris. From the first interaction to the last, every encounter with the hotel staff was delightful. Our room was ready when we arrived (early) and was great - certainly not huge but big enough to unpack our bags and love comfortably for a week. The bathroom was clean, shower was super - very nice rain head shower - with high quality toiletries. The location was amazing - it felt like Notre Dame was in our back yard. We walked every day and felt very centrally located. Meals at night were in the 5th or 2nd, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean accommodation, excellent service and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tyronedmonds
Reviews.Content: My partner and I paid 110 Euros per night for a weekend stay. We have stayed in a few different hotels in Paris and this exceeded my expectations in terms of value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Planejane955
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in July and was very pleased with all aspects of my stay. The hotel is very well located within short walking distance of the metro and RER for easy access to the airport. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and well decorated. The AC worked very well. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sumac_10
Reviews.Content: Loved this little hotel. The location was fantastic, the staff were very friendly and the room was small but cute and clean. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation in perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: kenLancaster_Ny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have twice stayed at the Abbatial St. Germain during the past four years and have had an incredible experience every time. The staff is friendly and helpful; they were able to allow us to check in early on both occasions as our flight arrived at 8:30 in the morning. You have everything you need in the neighborhood - cafes, restaurants (excellent Mexican restaurant across the street), tabacs, a variety of shops, and a few blocks away from the Metro. Will definitely stay there again in the future. One warning - do not use the money exchange on Blvd. San Michel due to outrageous commission and fees.

Reviews.Title: “close to st. Michel square - very quiet”
Reviews.Author: goanto
Reviews.Content: medium size hotel, in the centre of Paris, latin area, very quiet, could even sleep with open windows in May without hering noises from the streets. The rooms are quite small. Breakfast in Hotel definitely too expencive, 12€. I suggest taking a coffe and a croissant in the bar outside the hotel. Very good located, close are metro and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MM_World_Travelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on busy St. Germain and is only blocks away from Notre Dame. My wife and I arrive late at night and took to the train from CDG airport and got off just blocks away from the hotel. The metro is also right there and gets you everywhere in the city. The rooms were small, but was expected. The staff was very helpful and even had the Italian restaurant next door serve us dinner even though it was really late! We loved being able to just walk to a lot of the major sights. If you want a charming hotel that is in a good location and good value, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem with good rates, a block from Notre Dame!”
Reviews.Author: gbosquez
Reviews.Content: Here's a cozy little hotel just a block from Notre Dame and the Seine. Clean room, comfortable, quiet (we faced the side street, but the boulevard isn't too noisy at night). Most rooms have a little "Juliet" balcony which is great to people watch from. The bathroom was new and the staff at the front desk were all very helpful (and all spoke English). It's hard to find a room in Paris in the summer that is under $200 US per night that's close to the Seine and Notre Dame, and this one is very good! We strolled by the cathedral every night as part of a very romantic Paris vacation. There's no restaurant (they do serve breakfast, a little pricey at 12 Euros each) but you're in Paris! You're close to Saint Michele and lots of little side streets with restaurants all over. Two Metro stops are within a 5-minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel always perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca03
Reviews.Content: We first stayed in this hotel 5 years ago and were pleased with it then. We weren't disappointed this time either. The rooms are small as is the norm in Paris, but we had adequate room for all of our stuff. Room and bath are clean, view was lovely, and desk personnel always friendly and helpful. Hotel is well situated near Metro, shopping, and the restaurants we always return to. Easy walk to a number of important landmarks. Also, just a short block from Erik Kayser, the best boulangerie/patisserie in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again in the future”
Reviews.Author: SofiaLeRed619
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Abbatial for 4 nights with my mom. I searched tripadvisor extensively for a hotel within our budget, in the right location, and with a typical Parisian feel to it and this did not disappoint. Our room had two balconies that wrapped around the corner with wrought iron railing and views that you would imagine would cost much more. Not only could we see the typical street scene below with a gorgeous church and a fresh fruit stand, we also had a partial view of the top of the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame. The room itself was very clean and comfortable and nicely decorated. The best thing about the hotel is also its central location which makes walking to the St. Germain nightlife district easy...though far enough away to also provide for quieter nights. The front desk staff were also some of the nicest and most helpful I have met while in Paris and this was my 4th trip there. It was my mom's first time in Paris and I was really pleased that this place provided the wonderful experience I was looking for. She absolutely loved it! However, this place was romantic enough that I would consider it a great option for the future to take my husband. Highly recommend the Double Superior room as some of the other rooms looked small but are probably a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, fabulous location, fabulous staff.”
Reviews.Author: M1ssK
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel! The staff were so friendly and helpful. The room my sister and I stayed in was on the first floor but we heard very little traffic noise. There's no need to keep windows open as the air conditioning kept the room lovely and cool when it was roasting outside. It wasn't a huge room but perfectly adequate for our needs. I mean who goes on holiday to sit in their room all the time? The bathroom, again, was everything we needed. Everywhere was kept spotlessly clean and was nicely decorated. The breakfast wasn't cheap compared to some cafes but much better value. The buffet breakfast consisted of a choice of cereals, yoghurts, fruit, croissants, pain au chocolat, cheeses, bread, eggs, coffee, tea, fruit juices. You could eat as much as you want. All you would get in a cafe would be a croissant, fruit juice and coffee for only slightly less. All in all a very nice place to stay in a perfect location. I'd definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “surprised at the term "courtyard"”
Reviews.Author: DRT1404
Reviews.Content: We checked in to our room, which was supposed to be Superior |R|oom with Bath. It was described to us as being on the "courtyard" which was quiet. The courtyard was actually a 10 foot square shaft surrounded by four walls which went up the length of the building. there was no air circulation, and no view. the room was small and did not have much light from the "courtyard". when we asked for a better room we were told the hotel was full, but she switched us to a room overlooking the street. it had a view and more light, and was much better. the other room was certainly not a superior room, and should have been sold at the lowest price. we have stayed here before, but will not likely stay here againl.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, medium size hotel offers value in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: kugo21
Reviews.Content: We found the clean small room to be more modern than expected in terms of fixtures and the bathroom. It has a wall-mounted flat screen TV and a nice glass shower with removable shower head. It was a bit odd there was no bar soap or shampoo provided, just all-in one liquid soap wash. We opted for a balcony room and felt it was worth it for the nice view of Paris rooftops as well as luggage storage! The desk staff varied in terms of helpfulness. Everyone was reasonably helpful but some were certainly more knowledgeable than others. They recommend to us a nice restaurant called Maree Verte and if you say you're from the hotel you'll probably get treated well and receive a complementary glasses of sparkling wine. The Latin quarter is a very nice area with a lot going on and is at a convenient location to Notre Dame and the Pantheon. There is also a nice street market just down the road that has fresh produce as well as clothing and other trinkets. You will enjoy your stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Front Desk staff”
Reviews.Author: NormanandBrenda
Reviews.Content: Location was ideal for our 7-day stay in Paris. The room overlooking Saint Germain boulevard was small, but clean; free wireless was a plus. Hotel is a short walk to both a metro and RER station, which made travel around town very easy. I can't say enough about the Front Desk staff. Their dining recommendations were spot-on, as were the day trips they helped us plan. We'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great location on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: HOPETOWN34487
Reviews.Content: We would stay here again. Top two floors have several rooms overlooking Notre Dame and/or Boulevard St Germain. Great location, close to all major venues....within walking distance of most central Paris attractions. Stayed for three nights and never once felt the need to hop on the Metro, eventhough only a block away (Maubert-Mutualites). We have stayed in quite a few different hotels in the area, and this is our favorite for a combination of location, coziness, cleanliness, friendliness, and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: aakjer
Reviews.Content: The Abbatial Saint Germain is a great hotel in the heart of Paris, near Notre Dame and Louvre. The nearest metro station is no more than 150 meters from the hotel, and Notre Dame can be reached within five minutes on foot. The staff is friendly, helpful and speaks english fluently. The rooms are a little small compared to similar rooms around the world, but as far as we understand that is standard in Paris. Our room looked as if it had recently been refurbished - especially the bathroom was very nice. The room also had a balcony facing the Saint Germain boulevard were you could enjoy the late afternoon sun along with a good glass of wine. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCFamily372
Reviews.Content: We were so lucky to have found the Hotel Abbatial Saint-Germain! Spent a lovely week there. With blustery weather (and occasional sun and the spring flowers just coming out), the hotel was a comfortable, relaxing place to return to each day after a lot of sightseeing. The location is unbeatable, the multilingual front desk staff is friendly, breakfast (on the days you decide to eat in the hotel) is delicious. We had the triple room - at the very top of the building with a lovely rooftop view of the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy and very central”
Reviews.Author: fatcatz435
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the staff who were all polite, knowledgeable and helpful. The hotel is central and easily found. Rooms were very clean and functional - we were there for two nights but could have easily stayed longer. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel (12 euros) but dined at a boulangerie on the same street for 4.20 euros each. Would have no hesitation in going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating staff during a difficult situation”
Reviews.Author: themandy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Abbatial for a week at the beginning of April, and then again for an additional 4 nights a week later after some time in Provence. Both of our rooms were very nice and comfortable, with large bathrooms by Paris standards. Our first room had a bathtub/shower combo, and the second room had only a stand up shower. I preferred the shower only bathroom, as it had a much nicer shower head and was fully enclosed. I cannot comment on the breakfast. There are excellent bakeries within a minute's walk, so I found it unnecessary to spend 12e for the hotel breakfast. The desk staff and management was extremely accommodating when we ended up stranded by the volcano in Iceland. We were able to book a room the same day for a last minute rate. We ended up needing 4 extra nights, and the last minute changes of plans did not seem to be a problem for any of the staff. They were all incredibly friendly and spoke English very well. The location of Abbatial just can't be beat. It's minutes from both a metro and an RER station, which makes travel around town and to the airport very easy. The Seine and Notre Dame are practically around the corner. It is a very easy walk to Ile Saint Louis, Ile de la Cite and Le Marais. Overall, I very much enjoyed both stays at the Abbatial. My husband stays here every time he travels to Paris for business, and now I understand why!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: WeAreSeeingtheWorld
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the Hotel Abbatial and were more than pleased. The room was larger than we expected and the staff was really outstanding- helpful with everything from sightseeing to restaurants and finding a business/copy center to deal with some unexpected work-related issues. We had a teeny tiny view of the Notre Dame which was a nice surprise. Also it is very close to the metro station- so easy access to the entire city. When I am ever in Paris again, I plan to stay right here! I've already recommended the hotel to a good friend who traveled to Paris in Feb 2010 and she agreed- a great deal and a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizgNewYork
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a great location. Lovely room on the 4th floor with floor to ceiling windows over look the side street near the front of the hotel - so noise was not a problem even with the window open. Called the hotel the day before to re-confirm my reservations. The staff was helpful expecially Veronique during the day who was able to get me a room on the 4th floor even though the hotel was completly filled. She was very helpful with directiions and recommendations. The gentlemen at night (sorry I didn't get his name) was also very helpful with directions and recommendations. Small evelators!! - got you were you were going. Room were good size for Paris. Would choose this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great value and best possible location”
Reviews.Author: thearndt
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Abbatial, got a room on the 5th floor with a balcony, could even see the Notre Dame towers. Staff was always friendly, breakfast choice was good enough and not overpriced by Parisian standards, the location couldn't have been better; just a few minutes to Ile de la Cité. Rooms were clean; not large but the size was OK. Kettle would have been nice, but that's just a detail. Airport transfer is easy, just 5 mins walk from the RER station to Charles de Gaulle airport. Highly recommended hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: manxcat6IsleofMan
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect - rooms very small to "compact" would benefit from a little more storage availability - facilities ?? - it is a shame that there is no facility for having a drink of any kind in the hotel, not even hospitality tray in the room - I asked for an extra pillow and was told that there were none available because the hotel was full! - however, staff were good - breakfast perhaps a little overpriced, but convenient - amazingly the hotel is fairly quiet

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming english speaking staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: kambahkid
Reviews.Content: The excellent english speaking and knowledgeable staff were very welcome for a young solo travelling Aussie kid without a french word in his vocabulary. Close to plenty of nice restaraunts, bars, shops, RER and metro. The slow small elevator that fits one or two albeit intimately adds excellent charm to the place. I would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location-few frills”
Reviews.Author: simms2009
Reviews.Content: Excellent location at a very resonable price by Paris standards. The room wasn't ready at published check in time which made things a bit more difficult given the very early morning arrival into Paris, however the hotel was able to store our bags while we explored the city. Clean (small) rooms with excellent assistance from the front desk staff. We liked the fact the desk was staffed 24/7. Located in an amazing part of paris within walking distance to Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Location is ALL”
Reviews.Author: JohnGMorpeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Monday until Friday and had been to the hotel before. Rooms are small,typical for Paris, but the location is perfect and the best reason for staying here. Notre Dame is round the corner, the Pantheon is 5 minutes away as is Luxembourg Gardens.Hotel De Ville just across the river plus Marais District. Many restaurants and cafes all around,plus RER & Metro station within a few minutes walk. Easy to Very friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, personable staff that went out of their way to help”
Reviews.Author: Louisvilledoc
Reviews.Content: Just back from Paris after staying five days at Abbatial St. Germain. Excellent value for the money. Vanessa was incredibly helpful, even going to the length of sending a driver to the airport with our passports which we had left in the room safe (we won't discuss how STUPID that was!). The hotel is in a perfect location in Paris, very close to Notre Dame, the Louvre, Hotel de Ville among others. This is our fifth trip to Paris since 2002 and we will happily stay at Hotel Abbatial in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Simple with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mei1024
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor, and I have to say it was even better than I expected. The room was small, but it had everything you'd need - a very comfy bed, a TV, sparkly clean bathroom with amenities and hair dryer, desk, fridge, and two large windows with a beautiful view of the top of the Pantheon. The staff was friendly and helpful - even brewed me some fresh coffee at 5 am while I waited for my taxi. :) But the best part of the hotel was the location. It was just steps away from the Metro, an 8 minute walk to St Michel station for the RER, and Notre Dame was just a nice 5 minute walk away. There were also lots of nice restaurants and bakeries nearby. Not to mention a supermarket across the street and a couple of pharmacies as well. Basically there wasn't anything that I needed that I couldn't get within a 5 minutes' walk. If you're like me who spends most of their vacation time exploring outside and only need a cozy place for a nice relaxing shower and some quality sleep, I'd definitely recommend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: ian1903
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superbly located close to Notre Dame but on a elegant bouvelard with lots of shops, cafes and restaurants close by. Metro stations are also near and at weekends a great food market is held just up the road. The hotel itself was very good with good rooms which were clean and well set out. We didn't have brerakfast preferring to use local cafes (like the Metro) who do breakfasts and you can eat and watch the world go by. The hotel does not have a bar and the rooms like many in Paris are slightly small but more than adequate. Staff were all very pleasant and helpful. All in all well recommended for accommodation, location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Hollydaze4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our four nights in Paris, and were very pleased with our choice. It's clean and warm, which you want in the winter, and the staff were as helpful and friendly as you could wish for. We got a good deal over the internet direct from the hotel's own site, and like other reviewers were thrilled to see the towers of Notre Dame from our windows on the fourth floor. The location is superb - a few minutes walk to the river, maybe five mins to Notre Dame, 15 mins walk to the Louvre and same again to the Pompidou Centre and Rue De Rivoli. We really didn't need to take the Metro. I'd certainly recommend the hotel to anyone who's visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & clean with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tajkd
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel online after being directed to stay in the St. Germain section of Paris. Unfortunately, this is not in that section but the hotel was quite a find. It is located within two blocks of Notre Dame cathedral and several blocks from the Pantheon/Luxembourg Gardens. it is an extremely pleasant area to walk around in offering many good restaurants and shops. As mentioned by others, there is a station nearby which we used only to get to the hotel and afterwards we took taxis. The room was on the second floor. There is a very small elevator which can accommodate luggage but with only one person. the room was European sized (small by American standards) but very clean. It was well maintained for our stay. They offered TV in the room with English channels. The view was of the street but it was a nice view. The bathroom and shower were fairly new and in good repair, and also very clean. The room included a dining area for breakfast; a buffet with scrambled eggs, tea/coffee, cereal, fruit, bread, yogurt. In short, almost anything you could want. There was a small fee for this meal. Breakfast service went above expectations though as the staff offered several times to send coffee to my room (at no charge). Wireless internet was available and actually worked pretty well. Hotel staff was very friendly and offered to help us in many small ways; calling taxis & museums, special cleaning, restaurant calls/recommendations, directions. It seems a small family-run business and felt very comfortable to stay there. It is not really very near the Louvre/Eiffel area so taxis are needed. It does not offer American style luxury so be prepared if you book this hotel. Overall though, this was an excellent choice which offered a relatively inexpensive way to visit and stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: travellover6966
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to Paris every year for the past six years and we are truly in love with the city. Each year we had consistently stayed in the 9th Arr.and were very pleased with both our hotel and area. Friends of ours had recommended The Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain to us several times and this year we decided to make a change and try something new. Starting with the booking process Vanessa at the Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain was extremely helpful and accommodating. I explained to her how long we had been coming to Paris and that I was surprising my husband with this trip for both his birthday and Valentine’s Day. I requested a room on the 5th or 6th floor if it would be available and anything she could do to help me to make this trip unique and special for both of us. Upon arrival we were greeted by Vanessa and she is as friendly and kind as I had perceived in our correspondents. The room she had chosen for us was just perfect. We had a wrap around balcony that gave us a great view of the street and both cathedrals. We felt the noise from the street was very minimal. The location of the hotel could not be better with the abundant choices of restaurants, cafes, shops, Notre Dame and the river within 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel offers a nice breakfast if you prefer or you can go to limitless places within walking distance to satisfy your heart’s desire. Everyone on the staff makes you feel so welcome and wants to help in any way to make your trip special. In addition, there is free internet access in the rooms. This trip was more special and memorable than we could have ever imagined prior to leaving home. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Paris either for the first time or has always wanted to feel like they were a resident for a short period of time. It is very centrally located and the metro stop is within a short walking distance from the hotel. Vanessa and the entire staff at the Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain truly we make your trip a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality/price ratio”
Reviews.Author: 63romain
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in Paris, at walking distance from Notre Dame, Saint Germain des Pres and close to a Metro station. The area is nice and the staff is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: AuntJeanie
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly, speaks English, and have great recommendations for very good, well priced "non touristy" restaurants in the area. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, because you can walk down the street and eat at a dozen different places for half the price. The Maubert/Mutualite metro stop is basically across the street, which can connect you to anywhere in the city. Our room (# 44) was a decent size for a hotel in a big city, and very clean. We paid $105 euros a night. Even though it was snowing, we'd open the two huge windows, where we could see the steeples of Notre Dame, and let the romance of Paris breathe into our room. It was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Vanessa, she made Paris what is to me today.”
Reviews.Author: TheSeahawkRooster
Reviews.Content: I will never forget my stay. It is 'the' quintessential Paris Hotel. Located in the very heart of Paris (Latin Quarter), it provides fantastic access to all the modern transportation features, sites, sounds, tastes and smells. Although my stay was during a very wet and cold period, my room was very cozy and warm. My room was just the right size too, with a large queen sized bed, roomy closet with a very secure safe, nice flatscreen TV, and very adequate sized bathroom for two. Certainly when the city sleeps so goes the Hotel Abbatial Saint-Germain. A very quiet and restful slumber. The breakfast nook downstairs was also very convenient. It was clean, quiet, quaint and provided for an american sized appetite as well. The staff was exceptional! Everyone was so very nice and went out of their way to help me understand anything that confused me, provided me maps and directions to anywhere, as well as the best advise any friend would give another. The icing on the cake though was definitely Vanessa, the front desk manager. If I ever were to meet another Parisienne, I would have to say they would be very hard pressed to match her charm. She made Paris what it is to me today. Thank you Vanessa for all your help and understanding. Whenever I think of Paris, I will always begin with your sweet smile and delightful voice, then go from there.

Reviews.Title: “My best time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pankina3
Reviews.Content: Dear friends, At the beginning I definitely need to mention, that it was my 5th visit to Paris, and seems to be the best. Me and my colleagues were extremely pleased with the high level of the hotel. Everything was excellent: we were surrounded by the hospitable staff, were provided with a great service and delicious food. As a traveler with an amount of experience without any doubts I can recommend this hotel for visiting. Your impression from Paris will be even better during living in this place. Olga Lyapidevskaya

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: pabel1
Reviews.Content: Rooms were kept clean and nice. Like most of Europe, some of the rooms we saw seemed a little small but we got a nice one and had a wonderful stay. Being on the east edge of the Latin Qtr. we found to to be a vary good location with a subway stop not far away. We would recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Macabre
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two separate 5 night stays - one at the start of December 2009, and the other at the end of that month. It is not a bad hotel at all and the rate that we paid, considering the market in Paris, quite reasonable. The first room that we were given (room 11) was a bit small and dark, but very clean and reasonably quiet. It was, all in all, more than adequate for our purposes. The second room that we were given (room 44) was lighter and more spacious than the first. It was also very clean and quiet. The staff were reasonably helpful. They did not knock you over with their friendliness, but who does in Paris? We did not have the breakfast there, preferring to eat at the many cafes nearby, so cannot comment on that. The hotel is in a very good position. It is 5 or 10 minutes walk from Notre Dame, and near a number of Metro stops. The Louvre and the Musee d'Orsay are about a half hour walk away (quicker on the train). There are hundreds of restaurants and cafes within close proximity. In sum, not the greatest hotel ever, but very comfortable and clean and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great staff, great price.”
Reviews.Author: DerekAmanda
Reviews.Content: First off ... who we are = married couple, 31 and 30 years old. No kids. Minimalist packers who enjoy "blending in" during international travel. Location of hotel: Wonderful. Short few blocks to multiple Metro stops and only 2 blocks to a taxi stand. From our balcony, we had a clear (four or five block) view of Notre Dame. This is a true Parisian "neighborhood" with quaint shops and friendly storekeepers. Multiple cafes and bars dot the neighborhood. Our best "find" was an outdoor market on St. Germain, about two blocks west of the hotel (cheese shop; deli; wine shop; fruit stands; coffee ... all the things to make a quick stop to eat on the run). Service ... staff was extremely knowledgeable and ALL were fluent in English. On multiple locations, the staff made calls to tourist attractions for us to give us up to date information regarding tours, prices, etc. Value ... We give it a 4 (out of 5) because the price listed by the desk was much higher than we paid. We booked through Hotels.com and paid (after taxes, U.S.) $990 for SIX NIGHTS. The hotel's website list much higher, so do some shopping around. Cleanliness ... room was great, sharp, and the rest of the hotel area was in great shape. Rooms ... We give a 4 (out of 5) for only one reason (and it's a shame), but there was no dresser in the room. A small one could have fit we think. The room did not feel 'tiny" (I've stayed in smaller, more expensive places). We utilized the high shelving in the closet (which may be difficult for people under 5'6" or so. Also, althought the rooms have been updated, they only have ONE plug that is U.S. configured and it's not easy to use. The bathroom does have a hair dryer. Rooms ... (contindued) ... try to stay on the 5th or 6th floor if the weather is good. These floors have balconies you can go out on (as opposed to the lower flowers who have opening windows and flower-boxes). We stayed on the 5th floor on the side-street side (we will upload pics) and really enjoyed the unobstructed view of Notre Dame and the less-noisy one-way single lane road. Last thing ... Some people complain about the tiny elevator. What do you expect? All hotels (even the very expensive ones ... see below) have these miniature elevators. You cannot simply build a massive commercial sized elevator in a building that is 200 years old. Get over it. Recommend ... In Paris (for work a few years ago) I stayed at Hotel Edouard VII. At $600 per night, the room was smaller, bad bathroom, and very noisy (being on Ave. l'Opera). We plan on staying at Abbatial Saint Germain again during our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about the hotel was excellent. Highly recommend to all.”
Reviews.Author: GDC76
Reviews.Content: The facilities, location, cleanliness and rooms were excellent. The staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. We stayed at the hotel in 1989 and the improvements since then are remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, room not all that”
Reviews.Author: AeJUk
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay but our shower was very poor and kept leaking all over the bathroom. I reported it but it wasn't fixed. We had and amazing dinner at La Boutielle d'or opposite Notre Dame (very near the hotel). We went for 30 euro fixed price three course. Came to 71 euro with one round of drinks. Preapare yourself as Paris is expensive. I paid 16 euro for a pint of beer and a tea!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: shal227
Reviews.Content: Location is very good. Metro is 2 blocks away, walk down the block to the river and there are plenty of little cafes in the area. There is a small grocery and bakery on the next block. The 12 euros for breakfast seemed high, but if you eat a full meal, it's not. Cafe coffee is high. There is no internet to print boarding passes, but at Blvd St Michel there is intenet cafe next to McDonald's where for 4,20 you can get egg McMuffin, coffee, juice, pasteries and a yogurt drink. Desk was very helpful, rooms are small but clean. We had 5th floor room 53, balcony and view of Notre Dame towers Rm 54 or 55 was bigger, try asking for it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful artistic location close to metro and key sites”
Reviews.Author: xLauzx
Reviews.Content: This hotel was my favourite in all the places I stayed in Paris and Italy. In relation to comments made about small rooms I didn't find this -and the bathroom was much larger than many in Italy. The location was ideal for a first time visitor to Paris within walking distance of the metro line direct to the Paris Airport and lines to Versailles. It was an idea base to explore Notre Dame, Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Eiffel Tower and the Pantheon - all within walking distance! The vibe of this area - very arty and not as touristy as other places - was absolutely wonderful. The staff were extrememly helpful. There were also pharmacies, bakeries, fruit stalls within a 5 minute radius!

Reviews.Title: “Abbatial is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: RoadRich
Reviews.Content: Every time I think about the Hotel Abbatial, it malkes me smile. This is a perect, small left bank hotel that will exceed all expecations. We stayed there for 6 nights. It is in a great location, a 5 minute walk to Notre Dame, several very good neighborhood restaurants and close to Metro stops. The Abbatial staff was extremely helpful with maps, directions, restauramt suggestions and ideas for day trips. This small hotel made Paris seem immediately comfortable, easy to navigate and warm. When we return to Paris (soon), we will go directly to the Hotel Abbatial.

Reviews.Title: “Many duds in Paris, this one's a winner!”
Reviews.Author: reisemann99
Reviews.Content: Price = good, location = 5 star, Staff = helpful, friendly, Coffee/Breakfast = fine. Unless you want to spend double the $, stay here. It's got that authentic feel that most traveling to paris want (who wants a traditional hotel, in Paris ??). Was there 2 days on business, and I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: msmell7
Reviews.Content: I have visited Paris many times, and I always return to the Hotel Abbatial St.-Germain. The location is perfect, close to so many great sites, excellent restaurants, and an exciting and interesting neighborhood. But most of all, I return for the wonderful hospitality of the knowledgeable and helpful staff, the excellent quality of the rooms with their beautiful french windows overlooking the great neighborhood and views, and the excellent value. I've been coming to this hotel for years and will continue to do so. I'm always so delighted with the experience and accommodations. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel wholeheartedly.”
Reviews.Author: SarahRNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice in two years and love it; great neighborhood, clean and comfortable hotel, super helpful and friendly staff. The rooms vary in terms of space, beauty, and street noise, so if you are a light sleeper, ask for a quiet one. I will definitely stay here again! 8 A Huit, across the street, is a great market for snacks and beverages.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Therese18
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with some friends in Oct 2009. The location is great as you can walk to all attractions easily. Its a 5 min walk to the Notre Dame. Lots of cafes and nice shops around the area. The hotel is very close to the meto as well if you want to take the metro. If you want to stay in the latin quarter this is the perfect hotel as the location is just great! The only negative was that I booked a superior double room well in advance and fully paid for the room before I arrived. However when I arrived I was given a normal double room and not what I paid for. So make sure you get what you paid for when you get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value :)”
Reviews.Author: kaos_bobyn
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris before and I would say this hotel is a great value. The rooms are small, but are modern and clean. We had a nice view of Saint Germain. The windows kept all those noise of the street out. The metro is right next to the hotel which is a major plus. We took it everywhere and it saved us a lot of time. The staff is great too and willing to help with any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value”
Reviews.Author: mark_SydNSW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, near stations for the RER and Metro rail networks, and the Notre Dame and the Seine are only a block away. There are also lots of restaurants nearby (including a district with laneways full of eateries). The staff spoke English and were friendly and helpful, with the exception of the breakfast waitress. On the one morning I had breakfast there with my travelling companion the waitress got agitated when I spoke in English and talked back to me loudly in French, and seemed exasperated when I didn’t understand what she was saying. The room itself was clean and basic but adequate. I would be happy to stay here again (sans breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: RedTraveller35
Reviews.Content: After seeing our room I asked at reception if there were any other rooms available as this seemed a little small. The receptionist was extremely nice and helpful and put us into room 25 - which was lovely and spacious with a balcony. All the staff made us very welcome and were very helpful and friendly during our stay. This all helped me and my fiancee to have a wonderful few days in Paris and celebrate her 30th birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: EliIreland
Reviews.Content: lovely comfortable rooms, decor a little dated, but clean and warm, nice ensuite. Very close to metro, a breath away from Notre Dame cathedral and great Latin Quatar clubs, bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JuddyDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fantastic. Notre Dame is within a stone's throw and we were able to easliy walk to many of the sights. The area is packed with excellent restaurants, cafes and markets. We felt very safe walking around by day and by night. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. The rooms we had were both small and rather dark with a view over an interior courtyard but were clean and comfortable. I would recommend it to others because of the excellent situation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: vauxlevicomte
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Abbatial is wonderful!!! So very helpful and friendly. The location is ideal ,being within easy walking distance to major Left Bank sights, restaurants, and transportation... I always look forward to staying here when visiting Paris

Reviews.Title: “Charming and helpful Staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: MojiChicago
Reviews.Content: The staff were so helpful and accommodating, they really made our trip so much more enjoyable. Location is great spot to get around - - key metro stops within two blocks in either direction, and just across the river/one street over from the Seine directly across from Notre Dame Cathedral. Walking around the Latin Quarter and Rue St. Germain, sitting at a cafe having espresso....it was so hard to come home! Our room and overall hotel were recently remodeled in a quaint Euro style, and while a small room, it was spotless and a perfect touch-down space for the two of us. Not a bad rate for Paris. Our room overlooked the side street, not directly over Blvd St. Germain, so it was not noisy. However, other guests could occasionally be heard coming and going when we were sleeping in after a late, great night out. Overall, we could not have enjoyed our trip any more. Oh, PS - we got engaged while in Paris, so obviously the overall ambiance and romance of the city took us in!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better location”
Reviews.Author: SherryBeth
Reviews.Content: When I think of all the other hotels I considered, I thank my lucky stars we selected this one. We were one block from the Seine and Notre Dame and took advantage by taking many walks to Ile de la Cite and Ile St. Louis. You're around the corner from Shakespeare and Co. and two blocks from Breakfast In America (sorry, but you'll love this when you've had it with les croissants). Saturday night action on the Left Bank is a stone's throw away. The room was clean, the windows soundproof, nice lobby. My only recommendation would be to offer a cheaper breakfast for those who don't want to spend $18.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the Latin Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: slogam
Reviews.Content: We loved our corner room on the 5th floor. A really great value.

Reviews.Title: “Fleeting stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MissingDisco
Reviews.Content: Great location. The rooms are smallish (but we were well warned that this is expected in Paris) but very comfortable and super clean. Staff were extremely helpful. Considering the hotel is just somewhere to rest your head after a day of exploring - this hotel was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great area with friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BTTravelLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel was comfortable and clean. Very well positioned for the left bank. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is close to everything is clean and has friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Gconballyroe
Reviews.Content: I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anybody. Upon our arrival we were made to feel welcome straight away and after a long day travelling that means everything. Our room although small was clean and cosy and a pleasure to come back to every night. The breakfast the start to each day was adequate in the basement room and served with a smile at all times by a very friendly staff. The staff at reception were at all times helpful and friendly and took the trouble in booking our tour which we enjoyed immensely. The location of this hotel is worth the money alone with Noitre Dame less than five minutes away and plenty of other interesting places nearby. Our second time staying and we will come again. J O Connor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: zanoni5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Abbatial 5 nights for our 1 Year Anniversary. We stayed in a deluxe room and were very pleased with the size, especially after hearing stories about European rooms being so small. Yes, smaller than the normal American hotel, but it was fine with us. The hotel staff was tremendous; very accomodating, friendly and helpful. They all spoke English as well as their native French. My wife and I absolutely loved the area. Very close to major sites such as Notre Dame, great shopping, restaraunts and located by major Metros for convenience. We stayed right on the street which was a bit noisy in the mornings. So if you need your sleep, ask for an inner room. All-in-all, very satisfied. We would recommend this place to family and friends, and we would always come back. THANKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sabeltann
Reviews.Content: We had a superior room with double bed. The room was nice but small, as I think they are i Paris. It was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. I thought the aircondition did not work, and the next day she told me they had not put it on and forgot to tell me. A big miss there. We ate breakfast at the nearby bakery...very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sc1416
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located so close to the Notre Dame, the Louvre and so many other great sites within walking distance. The neighbourhood is lovely, lots of cafes, etc to choose from. Close to a metro stop as well. The hotel staff were pleasant and spoke English, and our room was great! Small balcony overlooking Blvd St Germain which we thoroughly enjoyed (thanks to the staff for lending us a wine opener and glasses!), and the noise was not a problem at all. The bathroom/shower was spotless and modern, and the bed was perfectly comfortable. Room was tiny but we needed nothing more. Not the cheapest option but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good”
Reviews.Author: Donricodelavega
Reviews.Content: THE ROOM First word that comes to mind when entering the room is "small". But apparently this is the norm for this part of town. Old buildings don't have big rooms in the Latin quarter. The room size (room 15) broke down like this. About 1-2 feet between the double bed, and the walls, one 3 x 4 ft nook with a closet and a small bathroom with a tub. Overall I'd say maybe 200 square ft of space if that. The room does include a small safe, small fridge and a small TV. There are 2 juliet balconies in this room, but don't' be surprised if having multiple suitcases means you can only access one. THE HOTEL The people here are very nice and speak English. I've never encountered this before, but you have to leave your card key with reception whenever you leave. When you return you just indicate your room number and they give you the key. I'm not sure what stops strangers from strolling in and asking for a random room key. But it wasn't a problem when we were there. We had breakfast included in our package, but we wished we didn't. Not because it was bad, but because we cold get a lot more outside of the hotel for 6 Euros per person. If you have the option to skip the breakfast, you should do so. There are bakeries and cheese shops in the neighbourhood where you can get much more for less. This place is a 5 minute walk to the back side of the Notre Dame Cathedral. I do believe we heard the bells ringing from our room on more than one occasion. The nieghbourhood is fairly quiet at night, even though it feels like a prime location. There is a Metro station less than a 5 minute was to the west of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: choz02
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 9/23 - 9/27. We loved the hotel. Very clean and the staff we found to be excelent. The spoke english which was a very big help to us since we speak zero french. We had room 47, it overlookes the fron of the hotel with a great veiw af the church across the street. Our room was small with a nice size bathroom. But from what i heard most rooms are small in Paris. We did not take the breakfast since right out the front door is a cafe that had great coffee and food. The hotel was near alot of great things and there is a metro stop just up the street. Unless you plan on doing a lot of bus and train traveling just buy tickets. 10 will cost 11,80 euro. The hotel can also set up a shuttle to pick you up to go to the airport that is alot cheaper then a taxi. The hotel has Wifi but no computer for you to use. But, Make a right out of the hotel and walk up St. gremain, walk just past the Mcdonalds and make a right ther is an internet cafe. For 1.90euros for 15 min you can use a computer and print out your boarding passes. I can go on for pages on how much we loved our trip, the hotel and there area. One word of advice. If you plan on doing alot of walking (and you will) bring the most comfortable shoes or hiking boots you own. All the floors are marble and granite and the streets are mostly cobblestone. My blisters can tell you this. Hope this helps. Photos to come.

Reviews.Title: “location, helpful staff and cleanliness were excellant and made our first trip to Paris memorable.”
Reviews.Author: jayandconnie
Reviews.Content: although it was disappointing to have to wait for the requested corner room for one night beginning our stay, we still gave a high rating overall because of very good service and cleanliness of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: MSandDS
Reviews.Content: Good location for visiting central Paris. Solid 3 star hotel, but in no way elegant. Room to room noise was minimal. Staff was average, neither very friendly or unfriendly. Breakfast was really minimal and poorly stocked, but "only" 12 Euros. The pre-paid rate was 129 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value, great location and friendly service make this hotel a top choice!”
Reviews.Author: montclairjoyce
Reviews.Content: The value is the key here. There are little imperfections but the broader experience is delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Let Down”
Reviews.Author: Casbeth
Reviews.Content: Booked in June to stay at Abbatial this Sept - plenty of notice. On arrival late last Friday night, we were told that the hotel was overbooked and we had been moved to Hotel Agora a little further down Rue des Bernadins. No apology; no explanation. Very disappointing. I would have hoped that they may have contacted us by email prior to our trip, so that we could make our own alternative arrangements. At this short notice Hotel Agora could not accomodate our requests, and we found ourselves in a very small room, 2 floors away from our daughters. The staff at Agora, however, tried very hard to make amends. Location is undoubtedly superb, and the hotel (from what we saw of the reception desk!) looks very clean and tidy. However, beware that this situation may happen to you!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Paris Experience!”
Reviews.Author: TXTripperHouston
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Me and my friend were 2 ladies traveling alone and we felt very safe in the hotel and surrounding neighborhood. We loved the area. The hotel was exactly what we expected it to be after viewing their website. It is quaint and charming, a true Parisian experience. It even had a lift (elevator), which I'm told not all Paris hotels do. We had a fabulous view from our window that overlooked a beautiful old church across the street. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We didn't mind that the room was small, which is very typical of Paris hotels, because it was very clean. The bathroom is small, but has modern fixtures. However, the shower stall is the size of a telephone booth (2 1/2 X 2 1/2 feet). There is no way a large person could fit in there. Also, the bed was very small and not comfortable. The pillows were terrible. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for someone who wants to experience the real Paris, and the price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn19
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great week at the Abbatial St. Germain. We found a "special rate" on the Internet of $85 Euros/night which included all the taxes. Breakfast was an additionnal 12E (we ate for much less at the bakery on the corner). We took RER-B from airport to St. Michel/Notre Dame and walked to hotel (could have transferred to Metro line 10 which stops across the street, but didn't know how on our first day) Wonderful location - 2 blocks from the Seine & Notre Dame; metro & bus stop across the street; great bakery on the corner; grocery store across the street; easy walking distance to Luxembourg Gardens, Sorbonne, Pantheon, etc. in Latin Qtr. Restaurants next door. Our 5th floor room was small, but adequate. We had a balcony overlooking Rue du St. Germain and mostly had our doors open day and night. The street was fairly quiet by bedtime and the fresh air was preferred to silence when the doors were shut. The bathroom was immaculate with fresh linens daily. Ice machine in the lobby. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_SP_Brazil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, a few blocks from Notre Dame, with a metro station 1 block away and with facilities (cafes/ grocery/ bakery) all around. Rooms are comfortable, albeit a bit small. Free wifi is available, friendly staff. Would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect affordable location”
Reviews.Author: thomalm
Reviews.Content: I dont have much experience traveling in europe so i had no idea what to expect from the Abbatial Sant Germain. I was pleasantly surprised. Of course the room was small but it was clean, heat worked, plumbing worked, we could not hear our neighboors and we felt safe. The location is 100% perfect. Very close to the river, the metro, notre dame and tons of shops and restruants. We were in Paris during the transportation strike so having lots of options near by was essential. I refered my coworker to this hotel and she was equally pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RashHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed by the standards of the hotel. It was located in a supereb setting that has loads of bars and restaurants and the attractions in walking distance. Staff was very helpful too. Only suggestion for improvement is tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. We had a 1 1/2yr old travelling with us and every time we wanted to make milk for her had to go to the breakfast room for hot water. If tea/coffee making facilities were available in the room everything would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gregandcas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the Abbatial Saint Germain on the positive reviews of others and we were not disappointed. Beautiful room with street views, comfortable bed, well equipped bathroom, but most of all, friendly and helpful staff. The location in Paris is also excellent, typical Parisian neighbourhood, close to the Seine and to public transport, restaurants and the Notre Dame. We highly recommend the hotel for your time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean rooms, nice and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: torcan52
Reviews.Content: Service: staff helpful, and polite. room service excellent. Breakfast excellent but expensive. Rooms: could be bigger, but for a stay in Paris it is the least important thing. Location excelllent, 5 minutes walk to the Notre Dame, minutes to the nearest metro station, close to the RER B (for the airport); nice resaturants in the area, very good bakery if you chose not to have breakfast in the hotel. Yummy cheese shop close by All in all, the hotel and area excellent.

Reviews.Title: “tiny room but great location”
Reviews.Author: twinkle_thing
Reviews.Content: I guess everyone expects a small room in a 3star hotel in Paris. So did I, but not quite as small as this one. And It was a superior double room. From what I understood, what made it "superior" was the bath tub, as opposed to the shower present in a standard double room. I didn't like the fact that we had only one room key, that we had to leave at the reception everytime we left the hotel. But we didn't have any problems regarding missing things and such. Oh, and another not so pleasant thing was the total lack of a view from the room. We had no balcony, but two tall windows that opened into a what seemed to be a storage area. And the elevator has to be the smallest and slowest i've ever seen. Me and my friend could barely fit together in it. And with bags, it was a real challenge. But the great thing about this hotel is its location. It is less than 5 minutes on foot from Notre Dame, almost the same from The Pantheon. The metro is always close in Paris so that wasn't a surpirse. All in all the hotel was perfect for what we came to do in Paris, which was to sightsee. We were out more than 12 hours a day, so the room was just a place to sleep and shower. And the bed and the bath were clean and comfy. Oh, but the air conditioning didn't work (it looked antique anyway, but because the room was so tiny it was never very cold, so that wasn't really a problem. I would recommend this hotel only to those who just want to sightsee and not spend a lot of time indoors. Also, with an early booking, the prices were quite low.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: moriaty
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel from august 14th till august 16th. We were in room 65 (about 10 sq meters) witch had a mall balcony with great views over St Germain boulevard and the Pantheon. The hotel is located very centrally (near metro Maubert - Mutualité), and a 1 minute walk to the Seine. The staff is very friendly and we will definately stay here again next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: bvtaylor
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Abbatial. We feel the hotel was a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: jojo
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel but the very best thing is its location. On the left bank but only a short walk to the right bank. The staff was pleasant and helpful. We had room 66 on the top floor overlooking Blvd. Saint Germain. Noise was not a problem except for 1 night when there was a routy bunch outside at around 2:30 am and even with the window closed we could hear them for about a half hour but otherwise it was quiet. The room was very smalll but adequate although since we stayed for 11 nights it would have been nice to have a bit more space. The problem was the bathroom. The lighting was not exactly over the sink and mirror area but rather to the side so it was not the best for makeup and shaving making it an even longer 12 days for us and because the wall was sloped you had to watch your head when getting in and out of the tub which for some strange reason seemed extra slippery. We did ask about another room and were given a choice of 1 other room which was oddly shaped and not much better so we stuck with 66. We did see some other rooms that were being cleaned during our stay and they looked much better, fresher looking and even a little bigger and brighter. We did not have breakfast there since there are so many places close or within a short distance. The restaurant selection on the left bank is outstanding. This is not a luxury hotel by any means but rather a nice pleasant hotel with good staff. We would stay here again but would definitely ask more questions about the room. On another note we had a terrific meal on Ile St. Louis at Le Taverne du Sergent Recruteur. We had the full dinner which included everything even wine...the staff there was wonderful and engaging and the food was terrific. When we go back to Paris it will be our first dinner stop. We also had a bit fancier but great meal at LeTrain Bleu. But then I guess where is there bad food in Paris...no place I imagine!!! jojo

Reviews.Title: “nice, quaint & quiet hotel located on a busy street”
Reviews.Author: greeneyeris
Reviews.Content: I wasnt sure what to expect because i heard mixed reviews about this place, but it ended up being a GREAT place to stay (or store my belongings during the day and sleep at night). It is very easy to get to from the airport: take the RER to St. Michel, transfer to the 10 and get off a couple stops later. Its a very short walk from the Metro stop to the hotel, which is a little hard to find at first (exit the north side of the Metro on Saint Germain, face East and walk past a couple streets, the hotel is tucked behind a cafe after Rue Monge). The RER is only 8.50euros, while taking a taxi is over 50euros. The staff at the hotel is very nice and pleasant (and they speak English) though (as i noticed with most of the customer service in Paris) they either cannot multitask (help more than 1 customer at a time) or they just don't want to be rude to customer #1 by talking to you at the same time (and instead they ignore you for 10 minutes until customer #1 is finished asking questions). Anyway, the hotel is very small. The rooms are tiny, but you have your own shower, toilet and sink, and the water pressure is fine. Also comes with free wifi and a hairdryer in the room. No need to bring shampoo; they have a 3-in-1 shampoo/conditioner/soap dispenser next to the bathroom sink as well as in the shower. But I would recommend you bring your own body lotion; looks like they refill what was left by the last resident, so the bottles have a bit of stickiness and residue on them. Also, if you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs. The walls are THIN! Beds are comfortable, but small (fits one person or 2 very small people). The rooms come with a little frig stocked with drinks. The pricing of the drinks aren't too outrageous. They are about the same as buying a drink from a cafe. But I would recommend you buy your drinks at the street vendor one block west on the south side of Saint Germain; they're cheaper by 1euro (or $1.50USD). Be prepared to climb a lot of stairs; the hotel elevator is very slow and tiny (fits one person with luggage or 2 people very tightly without luggage). I did not check out their breakfast, but its an extra 12euros (I opted for street crepes, croissants and an Orangina). Overall, this is a great place to stay. Its a very short walk to Notre-Dame and also super close to St. Severin (lots of cafes and souvenir shops open late there). If you dont like walking or taking mass public transportation, there is a Taxi stand right before the metro stop. I traveled to Paris alone as a single woman and felt relatively safe walking back to the hotel at midnight, but since the hotel is tucked away and a couple blocks away from the 'happenin' scene, i walked very quickly and vigilantly back to the hotel.
