No problems, I'm still alive! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: MilleDenmark
Reviews.Content: Great location, just a block from Notre Dame, good parking, we got a renovated superior room (very nice) on the second floor, but with a view to the courtyard ( only walls and windows) , we asked for another, and we got one with view to Notre Dame......very good service ( room 53).......Good restaurant nearby....Mexi & Co......10 rue Dante.....very small place but lots of food :-)

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Accomodations in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ALLREE
Reviews.Content: Would recommend using hotel-arranged shuttle to and from airport. Inexpensive, direct and eliminates use of train/metro system, especially if toting luggage. Walking distance to Notre Dame and the Louvre Museum. Try Bel Canto restaurant just a 10 minute walk from hotel. Staff is very helpful in planning tourist sites, restaurants and transportation around town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Gem in the 5th Arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: Francophile_Tourist
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. For 89E a night, I thought it was good value. In fact, compared to this other 3-star hotel that I stayed at near the Opera (which was a 2-star hotel posing as a 3-star - it didn't even have air-conditioning!), l'Abbatial was great value!! Sure, the room was small and the elevator was tiny, and the bathroom had a shower and no bidet or bathtub, but the room was clean and it had air-conditioning (this was summer, after all!) and it was in the 5th arr. And let's not forget, this is Paris. You can't get a room of a similar quality for the same price in New York, London, or Tokyo!! If people want a hotel that's right by Les Deux Magots, this wouldn't be right for them, as Les Deux Magots is a nice and healthy 15-minute walk away. However, l'Abbatial is pretty close to Notre Dame and a great bistro called Le Ribouldinge (on rue St. Joseph Le Pauvre), and only a short walk to rue St. Jacques and blvd. St. Michel. One other nice thing was that the lady at the front desk, a Bretonne, made a great recommendation for galettes and crepes in Paris (on rue d'Odessa, in Montparnasse). I can't thank her enough!! Like her (and most Bretons and Normands), I take my galette seriously!

Reviews.Title: “Good position hotel to visit main highlights in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mikySardinia
Reviews.Content: Hotel in central position, very close to Notre Dame, Panteon, La Sorbonne. About 100m from metro stop and 15 minutes from other attractions ie St Chapel, Conciergerie etc.. Great selection of restaurants in the vicinity. The room is very small but the bathroom is a fairly good size. The staircase that takes you downstairs to the small breakfast area is very steep. Infact we preferred to have breakfast in the nearby boulangeries (excellent selection of cakes!). The staff were extremely kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising quality with friendly staff and excelent location in the centre of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: LeSuee
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay in the Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain. The rooms are simple yet elegant, the bed was quite hard but the bathroom had a very nice shower wich always makes up for everything in my book. The tv didn't have much choice other than French or German channels, after long days walking the city a bit of mindless programs would have been nice. The location is very good, with parking very nearby and lively restaurants a few blocks over. I can very much recommend this Hotel for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “it is very good hotel with excellent stuff”
Reviews.Author: zura25
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed very much in this hotel... stuff are extremely nice and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern rooms and surprisingly big”
Reviews.Author: westham07
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by this hotel as we were only after a quick stop over in Paris. The room was immaculate and bigger than anything we've ever encountered in this price range in Paris. Great and convenient location for the Latin Quarter. The lift was broken when we were there, but these things happen and they offered to carry our bags up yo the 6th floor for us... I wish I'd said yes!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, location and service”
Reviews.Author: travelwell2007
Reviews.Content: Finding the right kind of hotel in Paris, in a good area for the right price for a family of four would almost seem impossible. The Hotel Abbatial were even better than their own website describes. The staff were excellent even before we checked in and I needed to check some details of our booking, welcoming during our stay and helpful with local advice. The area of Saint Germaine is fantastic and the hotel located perfectly for the metro and parking (underground). The rooms were spacious for Paris - we booked two interconnecting for the family. Cleanliness was excellent. Breakfast was lovely if a little squashed but very charming. The hotel is surrounded by cafe's and the markets down the road are a great place to get your daily supplied. Honestly no complaints or faults with this hotel. It was the kind of place you feel almost sad to leave in the morning and relieved to be back to in the evening after a long day. We did many price comparisons before we booked and for a family of four the Hotel Abbatial was "value" for money. From the hotel you can walk to Notre Dame, the Pantheon, the Seine and the buzz around the area gives you a wonderful vibe. I found the staff wonderful - always a smile, helpful and treating you like an important guest. This is a hotel I would definitely return to and a hidden gem for a great Paris trip.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3-star hotel without frills”
Reviews.Author: Jessica_Sz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two night at the Abbatial and were overall quite content with our stay. The hotel (as has been noted) is in a wonderful area making it very easy to get around be it to Notre Dame, the Luxembourg Gardens or anywhere else for that matter. The room is quite small, but we expected that--after all, it's Paris. The staff was quite helpful, but the standard of the hotel was unimpressive. From other reviews and pictures, I get the impression that there are very different types of rooms. The decor of our room was clearly part of a relatively recent renovation, but sadly already looks a bit worn with a couple of "mystery" stains on the carpet. The bathroom was efficient, but again very small. The windows were remarkably very good keeping the noise of Blvd Saint Germain at bay. They also offered free wifi, which was a nice touch and quiet convenient. All in all, it was good value for 120 euro/night in peak season. It was adequate as a place to sleep, which is exactly what we needed after our exhaustive jaunts around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: canadianjourneyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen for my first trip to Paris for the 5 days I was spending there solo before meeting up with a friend. Besides cleanliness and price, location was a large factor for me as I didn't want to feel uncomfortable coming back to the hotel at night - and that was never a problem with this hotel. In other respects, the location was perfect as well. It is in walking distance to nearly all of the tourist sites right at the heart of Paris (though some like the Eiffel tower aren't a short stroll), convenient to a metro, and right near the Latin quarter. I stayed in room 66 which was one of the 'superior double rooms with bath'. I would recommend the top floor rooms that face out onto the street, as that was part of the appeal for me. The little 'balconey' (really, part of the roof) was lovely, and I put the desk chair out there most nights and read for awhile. Noise was never an issue, not even when I took a nap right in the middle of the afternoon when I was tired after a very long plane flight. I would imagine this would be different if the AC was not yet on and you needed the windows open, but this wasn't the case in June. The view to the inner side of the hotel, were the washrooom window faced in this room, isn't exactly breathtaking. The room wasn't 'new' and luxurious, but it was clean and charming. The quality of the shower spray left a lot to be desired, but that's nitpicking as it did it's job. I did have issues with hot water one morning (though just the one), and the temperature didn't always stay constant, but it did it's job. The bed was older, but comfortable. It had the requisit in room safe, a television with a few channels, and well functioning and self adjustabe air conditioning. I had asked for early check in as I knew I would be arriving before 2, and was unable to be accomodated due to the checkout time of the previous person - however they do have luggage storage which they offered to me. However given it left a lot to be desired (basically their 'lounge' room where there were many people sitting and waiting) and I was exhausted, I didn't avail myself of it. The staff in general was very friendly and polite, and helpful when I was trying to find an internet cafe in the area - and tolerant when I idiotically hadn't been able to find the shade pulldown for the washroom window. Most of them spoke English relatively fluently, and the minimal school girl French I had was enough to get me by otherwise. The Abbatial is probably not the absolute best value in terms of price, but Paris isn't a cheap city, and in comparison to what I shopped around for it compares well. At least when you get a deal on their website as I had this particular time. It wasn't a fancy modern hotel, but I was charmed by it and liked the location, and really enjoyed my stay here. I was loath to leave for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: SethG
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very good, in an area with lots of shops, restaurants, and local appeal including a street market, very close to Metro, fairly close to central attractions and an RER line (St. Michel) to the airports. The room was clean and comfortable. I had a twin room that I shared with my teenage son. Free WiFi is a big plus! The price I paid made this a great value. The only negatives were 1) reparable cosmetic damage -- a large missing tile in the bathroom, 2) a very small TV with limit stations, which my son cared about, and 3) a bit of street noise despite double glazed windows, albeit not too bad. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Saint-Germain”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMoJoe
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this area of Paris many times in the past and this hotel is exactly what you would expect for a very nice three star hotel with a quaint ambiance and for a fair price. The lobby was comfortable and inviting. The staff spoke English and was helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable and clean, with modern air conditioning and soundproofed windows, that once closed kept out all noise. Television had international channels; there was a private safe, a minibar, direct dial telephone, and free Wi-Fi internet access even in my room on the top floor. The bed provided a good sound night's sleep. There is a lift to all floors. The bathroom was modern with a tub with shower and a hair dryer. The room had a balcony from where you could see the nearby spires of Notre Dame. The breakfast should be considered for the extra tariff and ambiance of the authentic 18th century vaulted stone ceiling cellar. The location was on a nice square near a metro stop (Maubert Mutualité), making for easy access to and from all of Paris, and is just down the street from the bridge between Île Saint-Louis (quaint shops and restaurants) and Île de la Cité (where Notre Dame is located). It is also near the Pantheon, and is in the heart of the Latin Quarter. I would definitely recommend staying here for a romantic getaway or a sightseeing weekend in Paris. I’ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recomend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jlh8026
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Feb of 2008 with my mother and we had a great time. It may not have been the best deal in Paris but with the location (one block from the river and Notre Dame with a great view from the balcony), near a metro stop, near the latin quarter, clean and secure... what more could you ask for? Yes, the rooms are small and you will probably get two twin beds pushed together but you are in Europe and that's how it is unless you want to pay a lot more. The staff was nice and helpful (especially the woman in the breakfast room) and the rooms were clean and looked like they were remodeled in the last few years. There is some street noise, especially if you are above the popular Mexican restaurant, but it’s not too bad for being in the center of the city. Their breakfast is pricey but good and handy. I would definitely recommend this hotel to just about anyone who would rather pay just a little more for a great location. We stayed on the second to top floor, below the apartment type rooms, on the side street with a partial view of Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Comfortable and Amazing”
Reviews.Author: confirmyourpassword
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled at the view from my room. I chose Abbatial because I liked the exterior, but the interior was even more amazing. Although, it was a little small, the view and coziness compensated for it. The bed and bathroom were always made and cleaned when I got back and the receptionists were very helpful especially with information on my way to CDG. If I had to pick one minus poiunt about the room, I think it would be the shower. The water pressure is a little too low for me (but I here that about Paris all the time, so it ma not necessarily be the hotel's fault), and the shower glass did not do its job of keeping water from gushing outside. There was a huge gap between the glass edge and the bath tub so I would have a pool in my bathroom everytime I had a shower. But like I said, the cleaners would do a good job of cleaning it all up so it didnt bother me so much. Another point, if I might add, is that they dont offer internet connection. But there are tons of internet cafes around Paris, so that wasnt a major problem either. In total, I had a wonderful stay and would love to stay there again if I had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: OMMIl
Reviews.Content: Hotel was renovated recently, and very nice and clean. The area is great, several caffes near bye, grocery store, and off course fromagerie, patisserie and boulangerie.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Dingy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: edobozy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were happy to be leaving by the end. The hotel is in a good location, but it is in great need of a makeover. The rooms are VERY small, but thankfully have a bathroom in each room (which, I'm told, is a real plus in Paris). Our room was clean enough, but it felt dingy and tired. There is considerable noise from the street. The air conditioning was not turned on yet so we had to open the windows at night and we were woken up at 2 or 3 am every night by people on the street. The front desk was fairly helpful to us and nice enough, I'm just not sure I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: bigfisn
Reviews.Content: The hotel, room, and service beat my expectations. The room was not very large; however, it was nicely decorated and modern. The bathroom was exceptional for Europe. The french doors opening to the balcony really made the room. (We did have perfect weather which contributed) The receptionist at the front desk were very helpful (Mark especially) The location was perfect. We were located one block away from the touristy areas (Notre Dam etc). Our area was quite during the week and fresh markets, cafes, and an internet cafe were located proximate to the hotel. We will definitely stay here again when we return. Will Wilmington, NC - USA

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: photobella
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our 6 day trip to Paris and I can only echo the sentiments already expressed here regarding the Abbatial Saint Germain. We had a lovely stay. We rented two rooms next to each other, one for my children and the other for my husband and me. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful and I don't think we could have gotten better for our money. And yes, the lift was tiny but I was so glad it was there after climbing the 400 stairs to the top of the Notre Dame tower! I had the same experience of the street noise with our windows open, but we were in the city, after all and night life in the city is noisy. The rooms are small but I wasn't surprised considering the size of an average Paris apartment. The bathroom was a good size and I also indulged in much time relaxing in the tub after a long day of sight seeing and walking all over Paris. I can't address the tv issue (our room had a lovely flat screen) because we never turned it on. Yes, there is construction going on in the hotel but we must have been far enough away from it to not have noticed it at all. All in all, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This place was so much fun!”
Reviews.Author: TakingBreaksFromWork
Reviews.Content: I really liked all the people at the front desk They were friendly, accommodating, and more than helpful. This is a small place in what can only be described as a super location. We were a few blocks from the Latin Quarter, one block from the Siene, and two blocks from Notre Dame. Coffee shops, restaurants and bakeries were all around. Bathrooms in the double and twins were big and tub was so comfortable I stayed in there for an hour! Tiniest lift I've ever seen, but it works. I thought it was fun. Two people in there together had better be fond of each other! My friend stayed in a superior twin--it was large, had two huge windows and was roomy. I wanted my own room, and a single was not available that night, so he gave me a double for one night for the price of a single, and the next night I switched. The singles have only showers, and you must be able to squeeze into it, and none of them are classified as "superior." My single was the smallest and least attractive room of the three rooms. Very brown, and had only one window, but everything worked and was clean and comfortable. And I could see the Pantheon out my window. The TVs have a reliable clock, a radio, and an alarm that works. Don't expect much American programming, but you are not in Paris for HBO, right? The hotel has no common computer, but the whole place is a hot spot. Fridge is good and has some drinks, including waters. Long distance was reasonable. My friend from Germany who had been to Paris many times before was grateful to me for what she considered a very good choice, considering the location, price, and friendly staff. Walls are thin in this old place, but otherwise very quiet--no street noise issues here. I have no idea about how AC might work, as all we needed in May was to open windows for air. When I left after 4 nights was so fond of the front desk folks that I felt I was saying good-by to old friends. I feel this place helped me have the perfect first visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: crs310
Reviews.Content: Nervous about this first trip to Paris and booking everything online without ever seeing the actual place is always a little scary. Very relieved after getting settled in and it wasn't as cramped as I had prepared for. The staff was really friendly, spoke great English, and the location was awesome. Nothing but good things to say from me!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Joanne13
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK. Unfortunately there was construction going on while we were there and therefore noisy first thing in the morning. the hotel compensated us for this inconvenience. The hotel was noisy in general though, you can hear water running and toilets flushing. We were not in our room much so the annoyance was limited. Location is good. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but...”
Reviews.Author: QueenCreole777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 7 nights at this hotel. Here are some pros and cons: Pros: - extremely helpful staff. Assisted us with directions etc... - close to lots of places to eat and very close to Notre Dame. - clean - free wi-fi Cons: - very small room (I prepared tried myself for this, but when we first entered the room was a bit shocked. We stayed in the superior double. We had three pieces of luggage and they barely fit.) - No A/C (During the day it was a bit warm. i was told that they do not turn the air on until the end of May.) - Shower splashed water all over. (the shower door only can half came to the middle of the tub) - Cleaning person left windows open when it rained. (it rained almost everyday during our visit, so with the windows open it left the carpet and one of our suitcases wet, which also made the room smell.) - the tv sucked (i know tv isn't the most important thing on a trip to Paris, but at the end of a long day i did flip it on. Only 3 stations in English and the tv was tiny.) - No iron in the room. (but they did let us use the one in the laundry room) - Bed was very hard, not comfortable. - Noisy (we were in room 53, facing the street. The noise was crazy - sirens, motrocycles, trash pickup. you name it we heard it. And becasue their was no A/C we had to sleep with the windows open.) Overall i guess you can't beat the price - for 7 nights was 833 euros. But if we are ever in Paris again i will spend a few extra bucks for a plusher, quieter hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable, clean - but noisy”
Reviews.Author: sabtravler
Reviews.Content: Over all our stay at this hotel was pleasant. We had one of the biggest rooms with a balcony. We didn't want to spend a fortune on a hotel and got a great package deal through the hotel's website. We stayed for 6 nights. The room was clean and comfortable. Since the balcony faced the street, it was quite noisy 24/7 - but that's not the hotel's fault. Some of the rooms are being renovated and construction started at 8 a.m. and the noise was frustrating. The location was amazing. It was just a short walk to the Metro, RER station and Notre Dame. If I could do my trip over I would stay in the hotel for 3 nights and in a hotel in a quieter location for another 3. Or, I'd bring ear plugs. Also, when the staff tells you that check in is at 2 pm - they really mean it. We tried to check in on our first day at 9 am. Then came back at 1:15 p.m. and the room still wasn't ready. Also the WIFI isn't free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, awesom service”
Reviews.Author: uka
Reviews.Content: We were a group of friends and we stayed at this hotel for a weekend in may. The loction is perfect. We used only the rooms and ate breakfast outside the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants serving breakfast (average standard). There is a bakery on the right hand side of the hotel when you walk out of the hotel and is situated on the opposite side of the road about 100 meters form the hotel. Try it:) The staff at hotel is awesome and helpfull with every thing and did a great jobb!!! The rooms are small and the ventilation is not that good bud the rooms are done everyday and tidy. There are lots of restuarants and bars nearby the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need right where you want to be”
Reviews.Author: tangot0m
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated quite near Notre Dame, but more important, just a couple of stops from connecting to most metro lines, which means all the important things are just a few stops away. Not the biggest rooms, nor the lowest prices and the biggest breakfast, but staff was very helpful and nice, everything we needed was present. The surrounding area is fantastic. Lots of small shops to visit in daytime, and a good choice of restaurants in the evenings. Quiet and without unwanted elements. Don't think it's the best area for partying/wild nightlife, but we didn't really try that. Tip: Wireless internet is available, but you need a code and they don't issue codes in the evenings. Remember to ask during daytime. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, simple place to stay in a great location--great value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: HavingFun094
Reviews.Content: My husband and I very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We stayed in a standard double room, and while it was small compared to US standards, it was everything that we needed and always very clean! There is not much room for extra large suitcases, or for many of them. We had one large and one medium sized suitcase...any more would have taken up too much space. But for us, this room worked great, and we were very pleased with it. The only remark I would make is that our room was on the side facing the busy blvd St Germain de Pres, and that was a bit noisy. The double paned windows helped, but when it got stuffy and we wanted the windows open, it was loud. Skip the breakfast--not worth 12 euros and find a cafe to sit and sip a coffee and have a quick bite. We would absolutely return to this hotel however--the staff very friendly and helpful (particularly Veronique), a great location to metro and nearby sights. Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: LuluBelleChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and loved the location and staff; Michael was especially helpful. We agree with all the positive comments listed below. We would stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient and 2 steps from Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: Bretacious
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed room, bath. In 2003 stayed in a smaller room on the street, so decided to upgrade to larger one and worth it. Away from the street the noise level was not objectionable. Nice big bed, tub and shower. Elevator is tiny, barely adequate for 2 people or 1 with small luggage! (Seems standard for all but nicest hotels in Paris) Great location literally a block from Notre Dame on trendy Blvd Saint Germain. Lots of cafes nearby, an open-air produce market across the street most days. Metro stop is less than 2 blocks away. Breakfast was decent for the price, though not extensive. Scrambled eggs, baguettes, cheese, yogurt, juice, coffee, etc. Being a French learner I was pleased when staff members would converse in French and not always switch to English immediately, which used to bother me but I now see is often their attempt to be helpful, efficient or practice English. There was some renovation going on on the second floor, but didn't interfere with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SandyChgo
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not be better. Just a few blocks away from Notre Dame and it is on a great street- the St. Germain Blvd.. Very close to a metro stop. High praise for how friendly and helpful the staff were. It's an older building, so it has the older building quirks (elevator built for one). My room was very clean and the bathroom was remodeled. It was a single, so it was really small. Bathroom shower a bit too small but do-able. Television was a joke (very old and tiny), would be nice to have a newer one with a bigger screen ( I like to watch the news before I go to sleep and when I wake up). Bed very comfortable and new. Need to update the wall paper (it was pretty gross and time to be changed out). Only downside to my room was the food smell from the kitchen somehow made it up and into my room at 5:30am...... (perhaps better ventilate the kitchen? or was it from another bldg?) Did not partake in the breakfast, there was a fabulous bakery just down the block. Good enough and a great price for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: evertonusa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is is a wonderful area of Paris along the blvd Saint Germain. The room was very clean and the service was friendly. We will stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DawnH6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, about a block from Notre Dame. While not in the heart of Latin Quarter, it is a close walk. Also close to the metro and many restaurants. Extremely convenient.. While we were there, there was construction, but the noise was kept to a minimum. The rooms were very clean, but our first night, our room was not ready, due to the construction, so we were put in a much smaller room. We were then moved to our room the next night. We just chalked it up to part of the experience! We then checked out and went to Normandy for a night and then went back to the Abbatial. At that time, we got our best room yet, much roomier than the first two! The staff was helpful and polite. I can't remember the name of the lady who was there in the daytime, but she was very nice, as was Karine. We had a wonderful time in Paris and hope to go back some day!

Reviews.Title: “Great little find in the beautiful city of Paris. Pais.”
Reviews.Author: danya123
Reviews.Content: No hesitatation in recomending this hotel. Perfect location for all your needs. Staff friendly knowledgeable and helpful. Will stay here again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Abbatial”
Reviews.Author: Jean_Valjean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abbatial for seven nights in April. Previous reviews cover just about every possibility. The hotel was clean. They are remodeling on at least 2 floors in preparation for the busy season. When traveling we do not need much in the way of help so are interaction with the employees was minimal. They were however friendly enough and as best as I can determine everyone spoke English. Check-in and check-out were fast and easy. They arranged shuttle transportation to the airport for us which cost only a little more than taking the train from St. Michel. Worth the added expense for me as it does help reduce some of the confusion with the train and drop off point at the airport. The walk to and from St. Michel is about 10 minutes and easy to do if you are traveling light, may be with a single roller bag and a purse or backpack. Consider that we are in our late 50's it is not a problem to walk to the hotel from St. Michel or the nearest metro stop. The hotel's A/C was not on yet but that is very typical in Europe for this time of year when the temperatures are great for sleeping with or without a window open. There was much street noise but that was not a problem for me though certainly could be for some. We never tried their breakfast as there are just to many options just outside the door. There were at least a dozen restaurants within two blocks and that many ATM's as well Great: Location, with good transportation options, far enough from the crowds at St. Severin yet close enough to many tourist sights to walk. Good: Good dinning options near hotel Bad: Small rooms, street noise The Abbatial is a good basic hotel and I would recommend it to anyone looking for that in a Parisian hotel. Do try the restaurant just next door, Trattoria Roma, at least that is the name on the canopy. Good food, great service, at reasonable prices. We did not have their pizza but judging by the high number of take out pizzas they sell they must be very good. These guys work hard to make sure you are happy, really.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: EevaHelsinki
Reviews.Content: Quite affordable but still very good location in the center. Cozy little hotel with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here...service and hotel upkeep terrible...what a disappointmentt”
Reviews.Author: W0rldTravel13
Reviews.Content: The entire experience was a disappointment. I spent much time researching hotels based on the info on their websites. The Abbatial said it had air conditioning but REFUSED to turn it on...When I asked at the desk they said "it was not the month for air" and refused to do anything. The shower nozzel fell off, the blow dryer head fell off, the bathroom flooded with each shower,the towel racks nearly fell off, there was construction going on above our room beginning in the early hours (5 am) of the morning, the shuttle we ordered to the airport and PAID for was never ordered even though they said it was! It cost us an extra 10 Euros to book a taxi than the shuttle would have cost...very poor service and maintenance...I will post this on every travel website for Paris hotels that I can find...they just didn't care.

Reviews.Title: “clean, close, cost effective”
Reviews.Author: conduitseattle
Reviews.Content: such a great hotel. room was big by paris standards, bathroom was spotless, bed was comfortable, nights were quiet (enough), and the location is extraordinary for the price. would stay here again and gladly recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SteFVG
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, we found this lovely hotel after some days surfing the web looking for central position, good reviews and inexpensive rate. We ended up with Abbatial and we had been extremely satisfied with all of them. The location is wonderful, just walking distance from Notre Dame and Latin Quarter; the metro station is also very close, and all around there's plenty of "boulangeries" and mini markets for daily shop-and-go. The room was not the largest we've ever seen, but after all we didn't come to Paris for staying in the hotel; it was clean and quiet, no noise at all from the street. The staff is friendly, English is spoken even if we tried to learn some French too... Should we return to Paris, we would choose Abbatial again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Naomi_Taylor
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room is cosy but impeccably clean. We stayed on the forth floor in room 46. If you are a not a light packer ask for a room on a lower level because the lift is tiny. It can only hold two average sized people. The staff was helpful and it was easy to navigate around the city because it was only a block from the subway. We could also walk to many of the sites including Notre Dame and the Louvre. The pizza place next store to the hotel is great as is the Mexican restaurant around the corner. Not to worry there are a lot of great cafes and backeries at your doorstep. Enjoy this hotel and all the location can offer you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good effort”
Reviews.Author: Polka99
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1 block from Notre Dame. We opened our window and could hear its soothing bells day/evening. Hotel doing lots of renovations. #47 room small but modern. Bathroom remodeled but shower water gushes out of the bottom and onto bathroom floor. This seemed to be a problem in many rooms. Sliding bathroom door didn't latch. Thankfully, traveling with my partner so used to intimacy but this lack of privacy was trying even for us. Staff nice and does a good enough job speaking English. Very clean hotel and room. Everyone friendly. Lift only big enough for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: RonLew
Reviews.Content: Great hotel next to Notre Dame. Wonderful staff. Clean rooms. The hotel was well kept and in great shape, but not fancy. We would definitely stay here again. The only negative was the shower door. We had to stuff a towel under the door to prevent large amounts of water from leaking out. I bet they regret buying the style door they chose. Also, you have to pay for internet.

Reviews.Title: “All the things I needed at my reach”
Reviews.Author: LaResistance
Reviews.Content: The Hotels Web site was a true representation of your stay. The location , access to food, transportation at your finger tips and a very helpfull hotel staff made this trip very enjoyable. A nice bang for the buck!

Reviews.Title: “The Abbatial was clean and comfortable and the staff very helpful and freindly.”
Reviews.Author: DTravelor
Reviews.Content: Located in a great area to walk and access public transportation. Plenty of restaurants and cafes, shops and sights nearby. Hotel staff is very helpful and friendly. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable and updated. My partner was a bit nervous about the tiny elevator. The lobby area is small but classy. The option for breakfast is a good one in a cozy cellar-like setting. The overall feel is quaint yet modern. Would have liked Internet access in lobby. Rooms had wireless I believe but we were not travelling with our computer.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: wuhanren
Reviews.Content: 4 nights staying in the hotel was nice. The hotel itself is OK - tiny room (really), but it's clean. The staffs were nice and helpful. The location is wonderful, closes to many major sightseeings and two METRO stations. I am, overall, happy with staying in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: chellertt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and loved every minute of it! Yes the room was quite small, and was a shock at first, but once we got over that we loved it. After all you arent in the room alot anyway. It was very clean, the staff were always there to help. We loved that you could hear the chimes from Notre Dame and even see the top of it out of our window. It was just a perfect location, so many places to eat. And we enjoyed being able to feel like you can get away from all of the major tourist spots after a busy day. It was just so relaxing. We would stay again in this hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JA05
Reviews.Content: Would defintely stay here again next time in Paris. Location is ideal with plenty of Metro stations within walking distance. Also the area is filled with resturaunts, cafes, bakeries, chocolate shops etc... The rooms were clean and very modern and we found the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Thom_ieCork
Reviews.Content: Stayed in ASG 5 years ago, and was very happy to return. Service is very good, location perfect, rooms are small, but big enough for the stay. This time I had 2 issues, the bathroom looked a little dated and in need of revamp, and the noise, from next door at 3am one morning (because of adjoining door not sound proof) and noise from work on another room on the morning we left at 8-9am did disappoint, but I will be back. Opt for higher floor if available.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparkeytec
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to Paris for our 1st year anniversay and wanted everything to be just right and the hotel plays a big part in that. The hotel was in an absolutely superb location - 2 min walk to the nearest RER and just 5 minutes away from Notre Dame. So many good eateries in the area we were spoilt for choice - could not have picked a better location. The hotel staff were extremely friendly, very good english and very helpful. I've read a lot about the size of hotel rooms in Paris on trip advisor and was pleasantly surprised by the size of our room. It wasn't huge but we didn't feel cramped in. The bathroom was very nice, looked modern, good shower and the room as a whole looked new with no blemishes. Overall we will be definetly coming back to this hotel for our next anniversary!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abbatial - Very Good for many reasons”
Reviews.Author: Freeman55
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I took a one week shopping and eating vacation in Paris. The location is perfect- one block from Notre Dame, close to the Subway and the RER to CDG and to Versailles. The hotel was very nice, clean. The bed linens were better than most at this price. The bathrooms were spotless. The staff was helpful and everyone spoke english. I would reccomend this hotel to any one who wants a bargain hotel in a central location. We walked to the Marais, with out spending the money to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean, uncluttered, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: QYvonne
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel right on Rue St. Germain across from Notre Dame that is clean, simple, uncluttered, with a comfortable bed and a renovated modern bathroom with great water pressure....don't research further. We were so satisfied....and we stayed for 6 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay...”
Reviews.Author: OverThereOverThere
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at this hotel for about 3 nights in late January. All in all, it was a very nice stay, although the rooms were a little cramped for the price, but the locale certainly made up for that. It literally is just a block or two down from the Seine and the marvelous Notre Dame de Paris. Staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. Their 12 euro breakfast certainly smelled good in the morning, but we passed for their a much cheaper deals to be found in the plethora of French bakeries near the hotel. And of course, the Metro and the RER are just a minute or two's walk from the hotel on the Seine embankment and the Ille de la Cite.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: rbyslpprs
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, friendly staff and very clean room. It was large for Paris (superior double) standards. The breakfast was too expensive, I felt, so I only ate in breakfast room once. Many small places around to eat and lots of bakeries. (I have never found a bakery in Paris I didn't like). The area is safe, busy and easy to use several Metro stations in area. A big bonus: it was within easy walking distance to the St. Michel RER. All in all, a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and location excellent”
Reviews.Author: joelmari
Reviews.Content: Welcoming helpful staff from front door to room staff. We found the location convenient to walk to Notre Dame, tube to EifelTower (night crowd small, lights in mist made it memorable). Using Zagat as a start and desk suggestions we enjoyed exceptional meals and help with directions. We stayed only two nights on travel to Camaroon. We clearly would return and recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great location & lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: NMerrigan
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days in St Abbatial at New Years, lovely hotel, very clean and very diligent staff re cleaning, security of keys etc Local area has plenty of shops and restaurants for brunch and metro station just a stones throw away, beware cafe Ronsard at the junction though if you are in a hurry, not gona happen!! Didnt avail of hotel breakfast as we were late risers so cannot comment... Managed to walk the full length of Boulevard St Germain due to the lack of taxis on New Years Eve but a hot dog with plenty of French mustard at the end of it certainly heated us up!!!! Wouldn't hesitate to recommend Hotel St Abbatial St Germain

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: Sharla0820
Reviews.Content: Area was delightful! Very nearby was a bakery, cafe, cheese shop, chocolate shop, pharmacy, Metro, etc. Very short walking distance to Notre Dame and the Seine. Staff was always pleasant and helpful. Rooms were as expected, bathroom was more recently remodeled--looked brand new. We'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, spotlessly clean, great location for exploring”
Reviews.Author: Eugor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice for a week each, the first time in June 2006 and the second in December 2008, with excellent experiences both times. The location is unbeatable - one block south of the Seine and the bridge that crosses both the Ile de la Cité and Ile St. Louis, just a few blocks from the Pantheon, the Cluny Museum, St. Severin, St. Etienne-du-Mont and other 5th Arr. attractions, and 1.5 blocks from the Maubert-Mutualité stop on the 10th Metro line. The Louvre and the Orsay museums are about a 20 minute walk. It is also about 4 blocks from the RER station at St. Michel with direct trains to CDG and Orly airports. The staff have been unfailingly cordial and helpful, and uniformly speak excellent English (although also politely tolerant of my erratic French without condescension). While the rooms are simply furnished, and are quite small by American standards, they are better than average size for Paris, particularly for the extremely reasonable rates (go directly to the hotel website for the best pricing and range of room options). The bathrooms are kept spotless and the rooms are impeccably cleaned. Beds are firm but quite comfortable. (On my second trip there was one section of wallcovering that was pulling away from one wall - a small quibble, which had been repaired the next day even though I hadn't reported it yet). There is cable TV and wireless Internet access with no extra charge. Heating is steam radiator, rooms are individually air conditioned (although controls are quirky and require assistance from the reception). The elevator is miniscule - barely room for two people, or one person and one suitcase; take the stairs when possible, they are wide enough even when carrying luggage. Keys are required to be left at the desk when you go out during the day - perhaps not the most secure arrangement, although the hotel staff seem quick to recognize clients, and there is an in-room safe (ok for small valuables but too small for a laptop, however). Interior rooms face a courtyard that is decidedly unscenic, but dead quiet if you are bothered by street noise (the Boulevard is quite busy). Skip the continental breakfast (12 euro extra per day) in favor of a cafe & fresh croissant or pain au chocolat at the coffee shop on the opposite side of Place Maubert for about 5-6 euro. There are excellent pastries, bread, baked goods and pannini sandwiches to be had just a block west at Boulangerie Julien. There are a number of typical French cafes and restaurants and interesting ethnic restaurants within 4 blocks in any direction, to suit any budget and taste (including La Tour d'Argent if you really want to go stratospheric). Bank with ATM and pharmacy are within a block. The area appears to be completely safe for walking at night. In short, this hotel is a small gem, and an excellent value for the money. I plan to stay there again whenever I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Rany
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in the St. Germaine district. Location is absolutely perfect. You can easily reach the hotel from the airport with RER B without any connection. The district the hotel is in is fabulous with plenty of cafes, restaurants and bar nearby. You can easily walk to a lot of the attractions. The reception staff was extremely nice and friendly and had impeccable English (not very common in Paris!). The room we got was small (as I experienced in other hotels in Paris) but it worked out perfect for us. If you have a large amount of luggage, you may want to ask reception if they can give you a bigger room. The lift was tiny but it did the job. Breakfast was nice, but there are so many cafes nearby that I am not sure it is worth it. The room was clean and had everything you need. This is not a luxury accommodation, but it is nice and well maintained (at least the room we got). All was good but what really makes it for this place is the location. We went to a very nice restaurant just around the corner form the Hotel called the Petite Pontoise, I will highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Returned to Paris after 25 long years!”
Reviews.Author: bonjour1202
Reviews.Content: I first visited Paris, well all over Europe more than 25 years ago! (I visited 13 countries in 6 weeks!) It is just unbelievable how time flies ever so fast; however, what is even more unbelievable was the fact that Paris, with some new changes, has not changed for most part. It still remains as one of my favorite places in the world. I thoroughly enjoyed my four days stay, and in the end I wished that I had more time to stay. It was just not enough time to visit with so many splendid places to see. I'll definitely return soon, if not next year. I was fairly happy to visit Louis Vitton store and made some purchases there, because believe it or not, I completely forgot to do that 25 years ago. The weather was not very favorable (Il fait tres, tres frois.); however, I was happy to see the holiday decorations. Thus, I'm glad that I visited at this time of the year. I hope to return with my children next year or soon. Merci.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Lockstock22
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed 4 nights in the Abbatial Saint Germain in late November, in a double superior room. I must say we enjoyed every part of our stay there. The room was a good size, very clean, with built-in wardrobes (plenty of hangers), flat screen TV, desk for our laptop, and the bathroom was immaculate with hair dryer, great shower etc. The double bed was two singles pushed together but that is European luxury for you! The staff were excellent, speaking English and always happy to help, offer advice etc. Always very friendly too. Our room was cleaned every morning if we wanted it, with fresh towels daily. The breakfast was very good also. Downstairs with a lovely French lady. Basically you get bread, croissants, yoghurt, coffee, fruit salad, juice, and cereal - as much as you want. Worth a try but there are also some other great places nearby which have a nice offering. Location is great too. Just a few mins walk from Notre Dame, and about the same distance to the local underground/train station. Plenty of nice little cafes, restaurants and shops 5 mins away, or if you are happy to walk 10-15 mins there is so much on offer. Thanks for a great stay and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmoore82
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay and it exceeded our expectations on all accounts. The location is perfect with a short walk to the metro and great restaurants in the neighborhood. The rooms were comfortable and the bathrooms were very spacious. The staff was very helpful and happy to help us make the most of our vacation. The breakfast is a little overpriced but the great location allows you to find a place to pick up a quick croissant conveniently.

Reviews.Title: “A couple from Russia”
Reviews.Author: TomNN
Reviews.Content: VERY good lokation! But a little bit noisy in room. You can hear neighbour very good :( Staff very polite and kind. In general I'm satisfaed.

Reviews.Title: “Love Paris in October”
Reviews.Author: WindyReno
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th time to stay at Abbatial San Germain. We love the location, the help from the front desk, the housekeeping is perfect, and except for the somewhat small room, everything else about the hotel is top dollar (and the fee was reasonable as well). We'll stay with you again. Merci. Donna Solum

Reviews.Title: “An Open Window to Paris”
Reviews.Author: She-Arrived-Damaged
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in a convenient location. We have stayed there two times now, and will be looking forward to staying there again when we return to Paris for our next visit. Our room was small, but very comfortable. We really enjoyed being able to open our windows.

Reviews.Title: “very central, absolutely positive”
Reviews.Author: aribari
Reviews.Content: Being located in the very heart of the city, I didn't have to spend time and money on public transport. The bedroom & bathroom were comfortable and adequate. Minibar, safe deposit box in room. The internet connection could be a bit more stable..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: IMORL_and_ALMOG
Reviews.Content: It was grrrreeeeeat! Clean rooms, breakfasts like at grandma's home, excellent service (thanks to Marco and the nice lady at the reception we forgot to ask her name...). Location - perfect! In Latin Quarter, 5 mins from Notre Dame, 1 min from Metro. Just 2 notes: 1. their "double" bed is actually 2 beds put together, so that might be little inconvenient for honeymooners (but we managed just fine...) ;-) 2. keep in mind that you'll be awaken by church bells at 7:30 :) In general, very calming, causy, romantic atmosphere of old 19-th century (?) building. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel next to Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: miticoroby
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for our honeymoon and we enjoyed our staying in this hotel, because it's 2 next to Notre Dame and Latin Quarter. In one week we succeeded in moving all around Paris very easily, because Abbatial Hotel is in a strategic position. Besides the price we payed was very good: we booked through the hotel website and we payed a superior room like a standard one, because we planned to stay more than 3 nights! Fantastic! I think I will suggest this hotel to my friends

Reviews.Title: “A great find.”
Reviews.Author: Camparilady
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this Hotel. Staff friendly and efficient, rooms were clean and comfy. Bathroom had recently been updated. Double balcony. Well situated for sight seeing and close to 'Breakfast in America' (a local cafe serving all-day american pancakes)!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to enjoy Paris”
Reviews.Author: Utiariti
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located and clean. Has a good breakfast with lovely croissants and a kind woman to help guests. The service personal are polite and kind. My room problem was the boulevard trafic noise that we could heard at night. I suggest windows noise proof.

Reviews.Title: “Cool little place”
Reviews.Author: 1Pianoman
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is in a cool location close to a lot of action and Metro stations. The rooms are a little tight, the beds small but tolerable. The elevator can accommodate two people with suitcases and that's it. If you can't do the stairs and are claustrophobic, get a room on a lower floor. It's clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abbatial is great!”
Reviews.Author: irishpenguins
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with our stay in the Abbatial. The location is excellent: Notre Dame is a 3 minute walk away, there is a metro station and a taxi stand. Restaurants nearby (one on each side of the hotel, numerous others in the neighborhood. Ile Saint Louis is also very close. The staff was always very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lonestar999
Reviews.Content: Perfectly nice hotel, clean rooms, good price, and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel- Bring Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: aweigel79
Reviews.Content: I don't understand where these other people stayed. It could not have been this hotel. The staff was nice but very unhelpful. The room we had was very very small ,but with the good view of paris came the traffic. The traffic on Saint Germain sounded like a nascar event. The only time it was quiet was 4 am to 6 am. Worst stay my life

Reviews.Title: “A review of a Hotel I did not get a chance to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Emeraldtec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were due to stay at this hotel the first weekend in September – It was a surprise for my wife as it was our first wedding anniversary. I did confirm shortly after booking approx 2 months ago and received a confirmation e-mail I also sent an email the Thursdays before travelling – no reply received and when we arrived on Saturday afternoon we were told they had issues with some rooms and we had no room in the hotel – but we were booked into another hotel two arrondissements over – i.e. in 7. They did pay for a taxi to the other hotel however it was not in as good a tourist location – they did state they may have a room the next night for us after phone calls were made to management but as we were just going to be in town for a weekend we decided not to move back. Hotel Vaneau was OK I have also written a review – overall I found this a poor experience in that I had planned to stay in this area and had planned our trip accordingly. I only ever had one experience of this before in Barcelona where rooms were being modified and when I arrived they apologised upgraded and moved us to a 4 Star hotel across the plaza – we were offered no upgrade or reimbursement here. Would I stay here again – who knows did not even stay this time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but nothing more...”
Reviews.Author: mwestermann
Reviews.Content: Room clearly above normal parisian standard for this class of hotel, but service is non-existent and the same goes for hot water in the shower. Walls are a wee bit thin so you can hear whatever the people in the neighbouring room are doing, whether watching the TV or errhm ;-) Location is fine - close to everything

Reviews.Title: “A good stay, with one problem”
Reviews.Author: SusantheAuthor
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abbatial St. Germain is wonderfully located with rooms that range from very small and a bit claustrophobic to larger with marvelous views of the street. It's staffed 24 hours a day, and its daytime staff members in particular are phenomenally competent. The problem is the air conditioning. A unit was available in both rooms my party rented--presumably in all rooms throughout the hotel--but they lack the remotes needed to turn the AC on. Neither of our rooms had a remote. On the second night, after a first that was hot and stuffy, I asked what I needed to do to turn on the air conditioner. The clerk rooted around in a drawer and pulled out a remote, which I took up to my room. At 11:15 I was roused from a sound sleep by a phone call from the front desk asking me to take the remote down--it was needed for another room. When I demurred, the clerk suggested I put the remote on the elevator and send it down, which I did. To me this was unacceptable. The next morning, a clerk told me this was standard procedure, that the hotel had never had a sufficient number of remote units. If you book with this hotel in warm weather, I suggest you do so only on the condition that you have a dedicated AC remote available.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and we'll come again”
Reviews.Author: nycastle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at this hotel and very much enjoyed our stay. We chose them after reading reviews here on TA and made the right decision. The rooms are typically Parisien, aka on the small side, but who cares? You're in Paris and should be outside. The room was nicely decorated, very clean and the bathroom was equally clean with a wonderful shower. The location is great, not too touristy but walking distance from Notre Dame and many other sites, plus the always convenient metro nearby. The staff were all friendly and helpful and while we chose not to have breakfast there (cafes right outside for less money), we were told that the breakfast was very nice. All in all, we were quite pleased and do plan on staying here again during our next trip to Paris. The price was also not too high.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain was a fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: angelloves2travel
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I went to Paris for 4 days to attend a conference. We stayed at the Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The hotel has a restaurant/bar downstairs and is conveniently located in the lively and diverse Quartier Latin. Tons of restaurants, shops and cafes abound and the metro is paces away from the hotel. I will definitely pay the Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain another visit, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: tokenresistance
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, great view from the room window to the street, easy access to train at St Michel / Notre Dame Station going to and from airport. It was within walking distance to so many places, sites and attractions and staff were very friendly and helpful. There was plenty of space in room, I used the mini bar frig. to cool drinks and store fruit I purchased in a small market across the street. There are so many restaurant and bistros located within a short distance. I checked prices of accommodation and it was reasonably priced. The bed was comfortable, the hotel and my room (+bathroom) were clean and well decorated. I would definitely recommend the Hotel to others and will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great small historic hotel, minutes from the Notre Dame.”
Reviews.Author: breng2903
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Abbatial Saint Germain, it is a very nice quaint historic hotel. We were in Paris for just 2 nights/3days and this was the best spot. It is located on the Saint Germain and a quiet side street. We would walk to the Notre Dame or just take the subway which is pretty much across the street. We didn't really use the breakfast but did go down for coffee in the morning. Rooms are not too big (hey, it is Paris) but they were very well maintained and clean. We loved the closets as they were a size bigger than we have seen at other places and the safe. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Keyri
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a lovely break in Paris and a reasonable price. Location is perfect, within a few streets of the heart of the latin district with all its bars and restaurants, and just far enough away from it for a peaceful nights sleep. We had a lovely view of the notre dame from our room on the sixth floor. Rooms are quite a good size, double and single bed in our room, lots of storage space, a safe and a mini bar. Nice sized bathroom (water pressure from shower was somewhat disappointing). Everything was spotlessly clean. If you are claustrophobic, do NOT use the lift, its absoultely tiny, just about enough room for 2 people., but the hotel is only 6 floors so not that many stairs anyway. There is a breakfast downstairs in the hotel for €12 per head but we didn't try it as there are lots of places to have coffee and breakfast in the area. This hotel is a perfect base to explore the wonderful sights of Paris and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Paris”
Reviews.Author: raw1011
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 4 night trip to Paris staying at the Abbatial Saint Germain Hotel. This is right in the Latin Quarter and proved a great base for discovering Paris. It's a few minutes stroll from Notre Dame, Pantheon, the shops and bars of the Latin Quarter and within easy reach of all Paris's best sights. The hotel itself is very friendly and clean, with pleasant, friendly staff. Our room wasn't massive but it was very comfortable with a nice, clean bathroom, large comfy bed and a great view from the two sets of french windows, looking over the Bvd St Germain. Breakfast was also ample but not sure it was worth the 12 euro it cost, we had a deal which included free breakfast so therefore it was a good deal! There were a another couple of things that weren't quite right however; the shower fitting to the wall was missing meaning you had to hold the shower, the air-con wasn't on but to be fair we never enquired about it. There was also a minibar in the room but no pricelist. Overall we would recommend the Abbatial for a reasonably priced, comfortable and clean base to discover Paris from.

Reviews.Title: “loved our Paris pied a terre”
Reviews.Author: stenson
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in Paris . The hotel offered a Paris sized room with lots of storage, lots of bright light, an ultra clean modern bathroom, and wonderfully helpful front desk staff. We found the breakfasts perfect! Fresh, plentiful and the perfect fare to begin a long day of touring & walking. The neighbourhood is wonderful. Minutes from everywhere and residential and peaceful. We had a wonderful stay at the Abbatial. We recommend it highly and will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Patti78
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a corner room at the hotel which had a balcony and good size room for European hotel, our friends had a smaller room and they could just walk around the bed so we definitely got the better deal! Good value for money for Paris in a great location few minutes walk from Notre Dame, metro stop outside hotel and lots of bars & restaurants nearby. The staff at reception were very helpful and always keen to assist us, the only downfall was that they ordered us a taxi back to airport on the Sunday evening and the taxi driver told us with traffic he would bring us around airport for the same fee but it ended up costing up €85! Double the cost to go into Paris.....we questioned it and he told us he could charge us individually which would obviously increase cost and then started talking at us in French which he knew we would not understand. Overall I would recommend the hotel just bad experience at the end so just watch out with taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Heidi_Norway
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel late in the evening and was welcomed by a polite receptionist. He was very willing to give us guidance about Paris and what the city had to offer. Our room was nice and clean, and we could see the Seine if we put our heads out the window. The hotel is situated only 3 minutes walk from Notre Dame and there are many restaurants and shops around the hotel. In about 5 minutes you will be in the center of the Latin Quater with lots of restaurants, bars and shops. We would also recommend you to take a stroll along Ile Saint-Louis (next to Notre Dame), a very charming place. We experienced to be woken up early each morning (4-5am), but this was just due to temporary work outside of the hotel. Conclusion: Good hotel nicely located in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit at Hotel Abbatial”
Reviews.Author: beanie89
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely stay at Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain. The hotel is within a two block walk of Notre Dame and the Pantheon and just a few blocks more to several other sites. Many tasty and reasonably priced restaurants are also within a few steps of the hotel's front door. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful with making suggestions for restaurants or providing directions. The room was clean, modern and had a nice-sized closet for storing clothes and luggage. Overall, loved the hotel, loved the service, loved the location and will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendywoosh
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews about this Hotel and I was worried, What a load of rubbish. I stayed in the hotel and found it charming. I took my elderly mother and she loved it. She had a room on the first floor and they had a lift so that was great, We were on the second floor directly above. There is nothing bad to say about our rooms Yes they were on the small side but so are some in London. we had rooms 12 an 22. the night receptionist recommended a restuarant and the food was lovely, Cafe Latin. I would use this hotel again. The only downfall of our stay in Paris was the non stop rain.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Price and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MOTraveler01
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried because the rates were so reasonable and the location was so great. We spent 7 nights and loved it! As is typical in Paris, the elevator was very small, the room wouldn't be thought of as spacious, and the lack of a full shower enclosure took some getting used to. But the staff was unbelievably helpful and friendly, the room was clean and less crowded than we'd thought it might be, and the bathroom was fair large, modern, and clean. The location is great--only a couple of blocks from Notre Dame--with easy access to metro stations and plenty of restaurants and coffee shops nearby. We booked our room at http://www.france-hotel-guide.com/ and were very happy using their site.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: FLLguy
Reviews.Content: Room 57 on the 6th floor, double French doors (soundproof the traffic with blackout drapes) opens to a small balcony over Blvd St.Germain, across from a medieval church, making the charming smallish room more open & bright. (versus interior rooms facing dark airshaft from a small window)Housekeeping service was superb everyday. Double bed ,no nightstand, single door closet & single door w/shelves (with lockbox) flank each side of the headboard. Writing desk, cube frig, chair & ottoman leave just enough room to walk . Decor in creams & browns are very nice with lovely carpeting. Updated bathroom,w/shower (stall only), door from bedroom is a single slider aka pocket door Small 12" TV sat on a wall arm shelf above the desk with a remote that had a dozen so channels in Fr,SP, IT and the BBC news. Note : AC is central and not turned on by hotel in April, so tho it was not terribly uncomfortable,(my personal preference is guest controlled AC) the open balcony helped to cool until bedtme when the street noise required closing. Thankfully, cool weather helped overall. A 2 "thin person"2 suitcase elevator with a lovely lobby and 2 room sitting area. (After a 9 hr transatlantic flight we arrived from the airport at the lobby by 11am, weary. Note that checkin is not before 2pm so be prepared to leave your bags and sit or wander Paris for a few hours! ) Superb location, walk to Notre Dame, the Seine, even the Marais with Metro stops very close. A word about the breakfast. Wow. I expected simple cafe and croissants. Way more greeted me. The intimate dining room is in their barrel ceiling basement reminiscent of a French castle with tiled floor & linens from Provence. Bright - inviting. A buffet of juices, cafe , tea or hot chocolat, various breads, "pain chocolat to die for", sweet pastries,baugettes and an assortment of French cheeses plus a silver warming chaffing dish of fresh scrambelled eggs. The service was very lovely with the staff showing real interest and kindness. The front desk staff were always attentive and most helpful but one person of note, Veronique, was very special and whose warm,welcoming smiles & "Bon journee" everyday could not help but ensure the start of a day to remember in Paris. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Loud”
Reviews.Author: kide0101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location near Notre Dame. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The front desk associates all spoke english which was very helpful. We were in room 35 which faced St. Germain and a church. Becuase of this we heard a lot of street noise (honking, cars, people, etc). Also it's right across the street from a church which rings its bells every hour. Maybe other rooms are more quiet. I sleep like a rock so the noise was no problem for me. But for my boyfriend it was another story. Loved that we had 3 large window in the room that completely open to let fresh air in. I would not reccomend this hotel for elderly as the bathtub is difficult to get out of and very, very slippery. If you like oysters I would highly reccomend eating at Le Bar a Huitres on St. Germain. You'll know it by the man standing in the front who appears to be selling shell fish on the street. If you walk from the hotel it's on the right had side of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with the world's smallest elevator...in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Yanman
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice hotel in a great location, this is it. We were there during the first week of March; weather was cloudy and wet for most of the week, which is what we expected. Abbitial has the smallest elevator I've ever been in; we're not big people, and we had to take separate trips with our luggage. The rooms are tiny (as expected) but very clean. We were on the 5th floor facing St. Germain Blvd. The reception desk was very friendly and helpful. We didn't eat breakfast there as there are a few bakeries within a few minutes walking distance. There's a little grocery store a block over and across the street, so it was convenient to get juice, water and snacks. The Latin Quarter district is a 10 minute walk away with a huge variety of restaurants to select from; most with set menus (appetizer, mains and dessert) ranging from 15 to 25 Euros. The Metro is just a block away. We bought 10 tickets to save money...and we used them all.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Abbitail St. Germain”
Reviews.Author: JTFRAZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel just this past February 15-18. The room was clean, reasonable size for a European hotel. The bathroom was also clean and usuable. Our room was on the 5th floor overlooking the street - the noise was not bad at all, but of course given the cool weather we slept with the windows closed. It was very close to major sites and about a 5 minute walk from Notre Dame. There were several nice cafes, restaurants and bakeries nearby, as well as wine and cheese shops. We did not get the breakfast at the hotel and instead took advantage of the nearby pastry stores. I highly reccomend this hotel, if you are looking for clean, convenient value.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: GatorNation
Reviews.Content: The Abbatial Saint Germain is a good hotel and a good value, particularly if you take advantage of their promotional rates. It is rated, correctly, as a three-star hotel, but it is near the top of the class. The highlights are the location, the cleanliness, and the staff. The hotel is walking distance to many famous sites and two hundred yards to the metro station. Airport transportation is simple. Take the RER B from CDG to St. Michel, and then switch trains and take the metro to Maubert Mutualite. I'm a novice and it was fairly easy. It will cost about 9 euros per person, each way. The hotel can arrange a shuttle to/from the airport for about 17 euros per person, each way. We took the train to the hotel and the shuttle to CDG. Both were fine, and luggage posed no problem. The housekeeping staff did a tremendous job keeping the room spotless and doing so unobtrusively. They were great. The front desk personnel, especially the woman who worked evenings and the overnight guy, were also great. Very friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. Now for the negative aspects. The rooms are small. Please spare me the "but you're in Paris, what did you expect" rationale. Small is small, regardless of country. We had a "Superior Double" room and it was approximately 9-feet x 11-feet, plus a small bathroom. The bed and armoire took up almost the entire room. Storage space is tight. The TV was a disappointing 13-inch (or very close) CRT. Approximately 14 channels -- two English (BBC and MSNBC), one German, one Spanish, and the rest French. The bathroom had a tub/shower combo and it did a bad job at both. The tub is small, but deeper than normal. In the shower, the water temperature constantly cycled, every 30 seconds or so, between very cold and very hot. Very annoying. And the water pressure was horrible. The shower had a half-panel glass separator between it and the toilet that was worthless. If you take a shower, the floor gets wet. Period. Why they didn't install a shower curtain or sliding door is beyond me. And as small as the shower/tub is, they've mounted the towel racks on the inside shower wall! Very odd. Every hotel has flaws, so don't get too discouraged by my critique. This is my second stay at the hotel and I like it. If they would fix some of these annoying faults, I would love it. If you get a price break from the rack rate, the hotel is a good value. p.s. Empty out the mini bar and use it as a fridge. There is a grocery store right across the street that sells, among other things, beer, wine and liquor. The Mexican restaurant and the Brasserie next door are mediocre. The restaurant Marie Verte, a side-street or two down, is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With The Abbatial Saint Germain”
Reviews.Author: AnnBellfield
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our parents to Paris for the first time and opted for this hotel. It is located quite near to Notre Dame and the lively area of St Michelle were all the best eating places are in Paris! Our parents are getting on a bit so we were particularly looking for a location near to the train station and a hotel with a lift. This hotel was a bit further from the train station than we would have liked but was manageable and was within walking distance of St Michelle and the Notre Dame Cathedral even for our elderly parents. The rooms were clean and had en-suites but were not overly spacious. There were a few little scuffs, scrapes and broken tiles about but nothing major that caused any real problem. We were paying for all members of our trip so we couldn't afford a top notch hotel and opted for a middle of the road one price wise and felt that we got good value for money at this hotel. The staff were friendly, spoke excellent English and the breakfast was very ample and all fresh. I would definately return to this hotel as I am not the type to get hung up on odd little bits of damage here and there. So long as everything works, the room is clean, the staff are polite and friendly and the food is edible we are usually happy and we were all very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Abbatial Charmant”
Reviews.Author: RoxanaCezar
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Paris and me and my husbad were lucky enough to descover this little hotel on St Germain Blv. Lucky because it has an excellent location and is very easy to reach it from CDG airport. This is a very important advantage because it takes just about 30 minutes to get to the hotel. Our stay was excellent and the staff contributed to this a lot. We had a very, very beautiful room - spaciuos enough ! - very, very clean and with very nice and friedly staff. Everything was excellent and we couldn't be more pleased. Breakfast is ok too, the French people have very good bread and croissants and with a good coffee it's quite enough to start the day. I've seen, in other reviews, complaints about the elevator beeing to narrow. It is, indeed, but quite enough for two people and a big luggage. Nothing to worry about. So, if you are looking for the best stay in Paris, pick Abbatial. It's really 5 minutes walk to the famous Parisian islands (if you have room no 52 you can actually see Notre Dome and The Pantheon through the window), river Sena, Louvre and Jardin du Luxembourg. Also, from here you can walk to Rue de Rivoli and futher to Champs Elysses. Also very near is Ile de la Cite and Ile Saint Louis and if you get there, don't miss Rue Saint Luis en l'Ile, were you can find many nice litlle bistros and shops with almost everything you want from food, to clothes and the famous Berthillon icecream.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abbatial Saint-Germain”
Reviews.Author: capthelifino
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a week at the Hotel Abbatial Saint-Germain, celebrating our 25th anniversary in Paris. The location was ideal for us. We wanted to spend our days walking to museums, churches, restaurants, markets, and neighborhoods, and that we did. The hotel is located on the Left Bank just a block from the Seine and then just a block down to Notre Dame cathedral. It's just across the street from the beautiful old St. Nicolas Chardonnay church and a block of very nice stores: convenience, flowers, cheese, wine, fish, meat.
